original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa gang dag zad pa la yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa gang dag zad pa la yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Arising and destruction do not exist for that which is exhausted.üîΩNor do they exist for that which is not exhausted.

original: ma zad pa la yang yod pa ma yin pa de dag gzhan gang zhig la yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma zad pa la yang yod pa ma yin pa de dag gzhan gang zhig la yod par 'gyur te /
translated: How could they exist for anything else?

original: de lta bas na 'byung ba yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'byung ba yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore arising does not exist.

original: 'jig pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does destruction exist.

original: smras pa / re zhig dngos po rnams ni yod de ma byung ba ni dngos por mi 'thad pas 'byung ba yang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig dngos po rnams ni yod de ma byung ba ni dngos por mi 'thad pas 'byung ba yang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
translated: Objection: First, things exist because it is untenable that nonthings arise. Therefore arising is fully established.

original: gang las byung ba yod pa de la 'jig pa yang nges par yod pas 'jig pa yang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang las byung ba yod pa de la 'jig pa yang nges par yod pas 'jig pa yang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since that which arises definitely exists, destruction also is fully established.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod shing bi du la'i shing tog dag 'dod dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod shing bi du la'i shing tog dag 'dod dam /
translated: Response: Do you desire the fruit of the vidula tree?

original: khyod 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin par dngos po yod par 'dod ko /'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag bsal bas dngos po yang bsal ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyod 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin par dngos po yod par 'dod ko /'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag bsal bas dngos po yang bsal ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: You assert that things exist even though arising and destruction do not exist. Since arising and destruction are refuted, are not things also refuted?

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: 'byung dang 'jig pa med par ni //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jig pa med par ni //
translated: Without emergence and destruction,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: an existent thing does not exist.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de 'byung ba'i chos can nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de 'byung ba'i chos can nam /
translated: In this way, if an existent thing were to exist, it would be a phenomenon that emerges or

original: 'jig pa'i chos can zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can zhig yin grang na /
translated: it would be a phenomenon that is destroyed.

original: gang gi tshe 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag @257b mi 'thad pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag @257b mi 'thad pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when emergence and destruction are not tenable,

original: dngos po yod do zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po yod do zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: at that time, how could it be tenable to say, ‚ÄúAn existent thing exists‚Äù?

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
translated: Without an existent thing,

original: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin //
translated: emergence and destruction do not exist.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir yongs su brtags na dngos po nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir dngos po yod pa ma yin par gzhi med pa'i 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir yongs su brtags na dngos po nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir dngos po yod pa ma yin par gzhi med pa'i 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Thus, because when investigated, an existent thing is not tenable, therefore, without an existent thing, emergence and destruction do not exist without a basis.

original: de la dngos po yod na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag kyang rab tu grub pa nyid do zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dngos po yod na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag kyang rab tu grub pa nyid do zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say, ‚ÄúIf an existent thing exists, then emergence and destruction are also fully established.‚Äù

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na /
translated: Here, if emergence and destruction exist,

original: de dag dngos po ngo bo nyid stong pa'am mi stong ba la yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de dag dngos po ngo bo nyid stong pa'am mi stong ba la yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: they would exist in a thing that is empty or not empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de la stong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la stong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But emergence and destruction are not tenable in what is empty.

original: re zhig dngos po ngo bo nyid stong pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po ngo bo nyid stong pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par mi 'thad de /
translated: First, emergence and destruction do not exist in a thing that is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa la de dag gang gis yod par 'gyur /üîΩngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang gi 'di'o zhes tha snyad gdags pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa de la ci zhig 'byung ngo zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa la de dag gang gis yod par 'gyur / ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang gi 'di'o zhes tha snyad gdags pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa de la ci zhig 'byung ngo zhe'am /
translated: Thus, for that which is not intrinsically real, by what are they real?

original: ci zhig 'jig go zhes ji skad du brjod par bya /
analyzed: ci zhig 'jig go zhes ji skad du brjod par bya /
translated: Because intrinsic reality does not exist, the designation ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù does not exist. What is there to say about ‚Äúthis arises‚Äù or ‚Äúthis ceases‚Äù?

original: de lta bas na stong ba la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag 'thad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na stong ba la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag 'thad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, emergence and destruction are not tenable in what is empty.

original: de la 'di snyam du dngos po ngo bo nyid mi stong ba la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du dngos po ngo bo nyid mi stong ba la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par sems na /
translated: But if you think that emergence and destruction exist for things that are not empty of intrinsic reality,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /üîΩmi stong pa la 'ang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste / mi stong pa la 'ang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩEmergence and destruction are not tenableüîΩFor that which is not empty.

original: dngos po rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ba med pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par 'thad pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ba med pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par 'thad pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: For that which is not empty of intrinsic reality, emergence and destruction are not tenable.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because intrinsic reality does not change into something else.

original: de lta bas na mi stong pa la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag 'thad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi stong pa la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag 'thad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus emergence and destruction are not tenable even for that which is not empty.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na /
translated: if emergence and destruction exist,

original: gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: they would be the same or different.üîΩIn this regard,üîΩEmergence and destruction

original: de la ; 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de la ; 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Are not tenable as the same.

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: It is also untenable that emergence and destruction are different.

original: re zhig 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: re zhig 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: First, emergence and destruction are not tenable as the same.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba ni skye ba yin la 'jig pa ni 'ga' pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba ni skye ba yin la 'jig pa ni 'ga' pa ste /
translated: Because emergence is arising and destruction is ceasing.

original: don tha dad pa'i phyir mi mthun pa de gnyis ji ltar gcig pa nyid du @258a * //
analyzed: don tha dad pa'i phyir mi mthun pa de gnyis ji ltar gcig pa nyid du @258a * //
translated: Since they have different meanings, how could those two incompatible states be the same?

original: 'gyur / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'gyur / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable that emergence and destruction are different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po thams cad ni zad pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni zad pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all things have the nature of cessation.

original: 'di ltar dngos po 'ga' yang skad cig tsam yang mi rtag pa nyid dang bral ba med pa de'i phyir dngos po thams cad zad pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po 'ga' yang skad cig tsam yang mi rtag pa nyid dang bral ba med pa de'i phyir dngos po thams cad zad pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: Thus no thing is devoid of impermanence even for a moment. Therefore all things have the nature of cessation.

original: dngos po ni ngo bo nyid las gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po ni ngo bo nyid las gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Since it is untenable that a thing is different from its intrinsic reality, emergence and destruction are not tenable as different.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, because emergence and destruction are untenable as identical or different, emergence and destruction are untenable.

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúI see emergence and destruction,‚Äù

original: khyod 'di snyam du dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mngon sum nyid du mthong bas de la 'thad pa gzhan ci dgos snyam du sems na'o //
analyzed: khyod 'di snyam du dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mngon sum nyid du mthong bas de la 'thad pa gzhan ci dgos snyam du sems na'o //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúI see the emergence and destruction of things directly, so what other tenability is needed?‚Äù

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?üîΩBecause:

original: 'di ltar / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin //
translated: Emergence and destruction are seen due to delusion.

original: gti mug gis sems bsgribs pa mi mkhas pa dag 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mthong ngo snyam du de ltar sems kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mthong bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gti mug gis sems bsgribs pa mi mkhas pa dag 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mthong ngo snyam du de ltar sems kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mthong bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Those who are obscured by the delusion of the mind think, ‚ÄúI see emergence and destruction.‚Äù Thus it is not tenable that they see emergence and destruction.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: 'di ltar gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par 'gyur na dngos po 'am dngos po med pa la brten grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par 'gyur na dngos po 'am dngos po med pa la brten grang na /
translated: As such, if emergence and destruction were to exist, they would depend on an existent thing or a nonexistent thing.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But those things and nonthings do not exist.

original: de dag med na gzhi med pa'i 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag mthong bar ga la rigs /
analyzed: de dag med na gzhi med pa'i 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag mthong bar ga la rigs /
translated: If they do not exist, how could one see emergence and destruction that lack a basis?

original: smras pa / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ji ltar yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ji ltar yod pa ma yin /
translated: Objection: How could things and nonthings not exist?üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'di la gal te dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag yod par gyur na ;
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di la gal te dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag yod par gyur na ;
translated: If things and nonthings existed,

original: de dag dngos po las sam /üîΩdngos po med pa las skye grang na /üîΩde la ; dngos po dngos las mi skye ste //
analyzed: de dag dngos po las sam / dngos po med pa las skye grang na / de la ; dngos po dngos las mi skye ste //
translated: would they arise from a thing orüîΩfrom a nonthing?üîΩA thing does not arise from a thing.

original: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //üîΩdngos po dngos yod mi skye ste //üîΩdngos med dngos med mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o // dngos po dngos yod mi skye ste // dngos med dngos med mi skye'o //
translated: A nonthing does not arise from a thing.üîΩA thing does not arise from a thing.üîΩA nonthing does not arise from a nonthing.

original: de la re zhig dngos po dngos po las skye ba med de /
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos po dngos po las skye ba med de /
translated: First, a thing does not arise from a thing.

original: 'di ltar bum pa ni 'jim pa nges par gnas pa las mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ni 'jim pa nges par gnas pa las mi skye'o //
translated: In this regard, a pot does not arise from clay that definitely endures.

original: ci ste bum pa ni 'jim pa bcos pa las skye bar sems na /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa ni 'jim pa bcos pa las skye bar sems na /
translated: But if you think a vase arises from the modification of clay,

original: de ltar na yang 'jim pa bcas shing 'gags pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'jim pa bcas shing 'gags pa na /
translated: in that case, when the clay is modified and ceases,

original: bum pa skye bas dngos po dngos po las skye ba ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar 'gags shing med pa ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa skye bas dngos po dngos po las skye ba ma yin te / 'di ltar 'gags shing med pa ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: the vase arises. Therefore, an entity does not arise from an entity.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag don tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag don tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, that which has ceased and does not exist is not an entity because an entity and a nonentity are different objects.

original: ci ste @258b yang 'di snyam du 'jim pa'i dngos po nyid bum pa yin par sems na /üîΩde lta na yang dngos po dngos po las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste @258b yang 'di snyam du 'jim pa'i dngos po nyid bum pa yin par sems na / de lta na yang dngos po dngos po las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that the entity of clay itself is the vase,

original: 'jim pa las gzhan pa'i dngos po gzhan mi skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jim pa las gzhan pa'i dngos po gzhan mi skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: in that case, an entity does not arise from an entity because an entity that is different from clay does not arise.

original: 'jim pa nyid bum par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa nyid bum par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because clay itself is called a vase.

original: de la 'di snyam du shing tog gi dngos po shing ljon pa'i dngos po las skye bar sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du shing tog gi dngos po shing ljon pa'i dngos po las skye bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that the entity of a fruit arises from the entity of a tree,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: shing tog las shing ljon pa gzhan yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing tog las shing ljon pa gzhan yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that a tree is different from a fruit.

original: de ltar re zhig dngos po dngos po las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dngos po dngos po las skye ba med do //
translated: In that case, an existent thing does not arise from an existent thing.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po las skye ba med de /üîΩ'di ltar bum pa chag pa ni bum pa nges par gnas pa las mi skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po las skye ba med de / 'di ltar bum pa chag pa ni bum pa nges par gnas pa las mi skye ste /
translated: Also, a nonexistent thing does not arise from an existent thing.

original: nges par gnas pa la chag pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbum pa chag pa bum pa'i dngos po las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: nges par gnas pa la chag pa med pa'i phyir ro // bum pa chag pa bum pa'i dngos po las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: In this way, a broken pot does not arise from a pot that definitely endures because a broken pot does not exist in a pot that definitely endures.üîΩA broken pot does not arise from the state of being a pot because a broken pot does not exist in the state of being a pot.

original: chag cing med pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chag cing med pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A broken pot does not arise from the state of being a pot because a broken pot does not exist in the state of being a pot.

original: de la 'di snyam du bum pa dngos po med pa tho ba'i dngos po las skye bar sems na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du bum pa dngos po med pa tho ba'i dngos po las skye bar sems na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: If you think that a nonexistent pot arises from the state of being a pot, that is also untenable.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po med pa tho ba las skye bar 'gyur na bum pa med par yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po med pa tho ba las skye bar 'gyur na bum pa med par yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, if a nonexistent pot arose from a pot, a pot would arise even when it does not exist.

original: gal te dngos po med pa skye na dngos po med pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /üîΩskye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa skye na dngos po med pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /üîΩskye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a nonexistent thing arose, it would not be a nonexistent thing because it would exist.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ci yang med na ni skye'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ci yang med na ni skye'o //
translated: If there is no such thing as birth, then there is no arising.

original: zhes bya ba de la su zhig yid ches par rigs /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la su zhig yid ches par rigs /
translated: If there is no such thing as origination, who would believe that ‚Äúit originates‚Äù?

original: de lta bas na dngos po med pa yang dngos po las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po med pa yang dngos po las skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, a non-entity does not originate from an entity.

original: dngos po yang dngos po med pa las skye ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po yang dngos po med pa las skye ba med de /
translated: An entity does not originate from a non-entity.

original: 'di ltar bum pa ni 'jim pa 'gags pa las mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ni 'jim pa 'gags pa las mi skye ste /
translated: Thus, a pot does not originate from the cessation of clay,

original: 'gags pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cessation does not exist.

original: ci ste dngos po 'gags shing med pa las skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po 'gags shing med pa las skye bar gyur na /
translated: If an entity were to originate from the cessation of a non-existent entity,

original: de lta na dngos po skye ba rgyu med pa can du 'gyur pas de mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta na dngos po skye ba rgyu med pa can du 'gyur pas de mi 'dod de /
translated: then an entity‚Äôs origination would be causeless, and that is unacceptable.

original: dus thams cad du thams cad las thams cad skye ba dang rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du thams cad las thams cad skye ba dang rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that everything would originate from everything at all times, and all undertakings would be pointless.

original: de lta bas na dngos po yang dngos po med pa las skye ba med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po yang dngos po med pa las skye ba med de /
translated: Therefore, an entity does not originate from a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa las skye ba med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa las skye ba med do //
translated: A non-entity does not originate from a non-entity.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa bum pa'i dngos po med pa las mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa bum pa'i dngos po med pa las mi skye ste /
translated: Thus, a non-thing does not arise from the non-thing of a pot.

original: bum pa'i dngos po med pa ni bum pa log pa tsam ste /
analyzed: bum pa'i dngos po med pa ni bum pa log pa tsam ste /
translated: The non-thing of a pot is just the cessation of the pot.

original: ci yang med pa'i phyir dang bskyed par bya ba'i don ni ci zhig gang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i phyir dang bskyed par bya ba'i don ni ci zhig gang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is nothing at all, and because the object to be produced is nothing at all.

original: ci ste ci yang med pa ci yang med pa las skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na ri bong gi rva yang rta'i rva las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste ci yang med pa ci yang med pa las skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na ri bong gi rva yang rta'i rva las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if something that is nothing at all were to arise from something that is nothing at all, then in that case the horn of a rabbit would arise from the horn of a cow.

original: ci ste dngos po med pa ci zhig yin na ni ci zhig yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid @259a * //
analyzed: ci ste dngos po med pa ci zhig yin na ni ci zhig yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid @259a * //
translated: But if a non-thing is something, then because it is something, it is a thing.

original: yin gyi dngos po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi dngos po med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a non-thing.

original: de lta bas na dngos po med pa yang dngos med pa las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po med pa yang dngos med pa las skye ba med do //
translated: Thus, a non-thing does not arise from a non-thing.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po skye bar 'gyur na de bdag las sam gzhan las sam gnyi ga las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po skye bar 'gyur na de bdag las sam gzhan las sam gnyi ga las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: if a thing were to arise, it would arise either from itself, from another, or from both.

original: de la dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
analyzed: de la dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
translated: But a thing does not arise from itself.

original: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
translated: Nor does it arise from other.

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ni //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ni //
translated: Arising from both self and other

original: yod min ji ltar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yod min ji ltar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Does not exist. How could it arise?

original: re zhig dngos po ni bdag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po ni bdag las skye ba med de /
translated: First, an existent thing does not arise from itself,

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa la ni yang skye bar brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / thug pa med par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa la ni yang skye bar brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / thug pa med par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is pointless to imagine that it arises again, since it already exists by itself, and because the error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis med pa la ni bdag las zhes bya ba'i tshig kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis med pa la ni bdag las zhes bya ba'i tshig kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: And it is not tenable to say ‚Äúfrom itself‚Äù in the case of a nonexistent thing by itself.

original: de lta bas na dngos po ni bdag las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po ni bdag las skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, an existent thing does not arise from itself.

original: dngos po ni gnas las kyang skye ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po ni gnas las kyang skye ba med de /
translated: Nor does an existent thing arise from another,

original: dngos po ma skyes shing med pa la gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma skyes shing med pa la gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that a nonexistent thing arises from another.üîΩNor does an existent thing arise from a non-thing, because it is not tenable that a nonexistent thing arises from a non-thing.üîΩNor does an existent thing arise from both itself and another, because each of those two is not tenable.üîΩNor does an existent thing arise from no cause at all, because it is not tenable that an existent thing arises without a cause.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig yod na gzhan yang yod par 'gyur na de yang med de /üîΩde med na gzhan yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig yod na gzhan yang yod par 'gyur na de yang med de /üîΩde med na gzhan yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, an existent thing does not arise from any of those four.

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni de nyid dngos po yin pas yod pa de la yang skye bar ci bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni de nyid dngos po yin pas yod pa de la yang skye bar ci bya ste /
translated: But if it did, then since it is a thing, what use is there in its arising again?

original: skye bar brtags pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar brtags pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For it would be pointless to imagine that it arises again.

original: de lta bas na ma skyes pas gzhan med pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na ma skyes pas gzhan med pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since it does not arise, it is not other.

original: dngos po ni bdag dang gzhan las kyang skye ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po ni bdag dang gzhan las kyang skye ba med de /
translated: Therefore, a thing does not arise from self or other,

original: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon gnyi gar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon gnyi gar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because both errors mentioned above would follow.

original: de lta bas na dngos po ni gnyi ga las kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po ni gnyi ga las kyang skye ba med do //
translated: Thus, a thing does not arise from both self and other.

original: dngos po gang bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las skye ba med pa de dag gzhan gang las skye bar sems /
analyzed: dngos po gang bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las skye ba med pa de dag gzhan gang las skye bar sems /
translated: If a thing does not arise from self, other, or both, from what else do you think it arises?

original: de lta bas na dngos po mi 'thad do //üîΩdngos po yod pa ma yin na gang gi dngos po med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po mi 'thad do // dngos po yod pa ma yin na gang gi dngos po med par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, a thing is not tenable.üîΩIf a thing does not exist, then what would be a nonthing?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag yod pa ma yin na gzhi med par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ji ltar yod par gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag yod pa ma yin na gzhi med par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ji ltar yod par gyur na /
translated: If things and nonthings do not exist, then how could emergence and destruction exist without a basis?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //
translated: If you assert that things exist,

original: rtag dang chad par lta bar ni //
analyzed: rtag dang chad par lta bar ni //
translated: Then the views of eternalism and nihilism

original: thal bar 'gyur te dngos de ni //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te dngos de ni //
translated: Would follow, because that thing

original: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: Would be both permanent and impermanent.

original: dngos po lta ba yod na skyon chen po gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po lta ba yod na skyon chen po gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur te /
translated: If you view things as existent, then this other great error would ensue.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po de yod par khas blangs na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po de yod par khas blangs na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that things exist, then the views of eternalism and nihilism would follow.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di ltar yod pa de ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phyir te /üîΩdngos po gang yin pa de yod par khas len na de @259b rtag pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa de ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phyir te / dngos po gang yin pa de yod par khas len na de @259b rtag pa 'am /
translated: Because that which exists would be both permanent and impermanent.

original: mi rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that any thing exists, then it would be either permanent or impermanent.

original: de las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that it is otherwise.

original: de ltar re zhig gal te dngos po de rtag na ni rtag pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gal te dngos po de rtag na ni rtag pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, if that thing is permanent, then the error of eternalism would follow.

original: 'on te mi rtag na ni chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de skyon che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag na ni chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de skyon che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is impermanent, then the error of nihilism would follow. Therefore, that is unacceptable, because it has the fault of being a great error.

original: smras pa / dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
translated: Objection: Even though you accept that things exist,

original: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
translated: there is no nihilism, nor is there eternalism.

original: 'di ltar dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //üîΩrtag par lta bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang // rtag par lta bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, even though you accept that things exist,üîΩthe error of eternalism does not follow,

original: chad par lta bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chad par lta bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor does the error of nihilism follow.

original: khyod gzhung lugs gsal bar mi shes pas de ltar sems par zad do //
analyzed: khyod gzhung lugs gsal bar mi shes pas de ltar sems par zad do //
translated: You think that way because you do not understand the clear scriptures.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po yod par khas blangs na ;
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po yod par khas blangs na ;
translated: In this way, if you accept that things exist,

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: then the error of eternalism or nihilism would follow.

original: de lta na srid pa mi 'thad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na srid pa mi 'thad par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, existence would be untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtag pa ni des par gnas pa'i phyir dang / chad pa ni mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni des par gnas pa'i phyir dang / chad pa ni mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because eternalism is the view that things endure permanently, and nihilism is the view that things do not function.

original: dngos por lta ba yod na yang srid pa 'thad pas de'i phyir rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos por lta ba yod na yang srid pa 'thad pas de'i phyir rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the view of things as real is tenable, therefore the error of eternalism and nihilism does not follow.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of the origination and destruction of effects and causes is existence.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu dang rgyu'i 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu dang rgyu'i 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni srid pa yin te /
translated: Thus, existence is the continuum of the origination and destruction of effects and causes.

original: de la gang gi phyir rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtag pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtag pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since the cause ceases, therefore the error of eternalism does not follow.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu 'gag bzhin pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu 'gag bzhin pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the effect arises from the cause that is ceasing, therefore the error of nihilism does not follow.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang srid pa yod pa'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang srid pa yod pa'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this way, although one asserts that things exist, the error of eternalism and nihilism does not follow because existence exists.

original: bshad pa / gal te 'bras bu'i 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'bras bu'i 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na //
translated: of the effect were existence,

original: 'jig la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
translated: then because there is no arising from cessation,

original: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the cause would be annihilated.

original: gal te 'bras bu dang rgyu'i 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de srid pa yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu dang rgyu'i 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de srid pa yin par gyur na /
translated: If the continuum of the arising and ceasing of the effect and the cause were existence,

original: de lta na yang khyod la chad pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyod la chad pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, for you, the consequence of annihilation would follow.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig pa la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar rgyu 'gags pa la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar rgyu 'gags pa la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no arising from cessation.

original: de ltar rgyu 'gags pa la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu 'gags pa la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, because there is no arising from the cessation of the cause,

original: rgyu chad pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu chad pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the consequence of the annihilation of the cause would follow.

original: smras pa / mi 'gyur te rgyu lam 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / mi 'gyur te rgyu lam 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Objection: It would not, because the cause and effect are not different.

original: 'di ltar rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: In that case, it is not tenable that the effect is different from the cause.

original: khyod kyis kyang /
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang /
translated: You also said:

original: gang la brten te @260a * //
analyzed: gang la brten te @260a * //
translated: What is the basis?

original: gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba //
translated: What arises?

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: It is not the same as that,

original: de las gzhan ba'ang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan ba'ang ma yin phyir //
translated: nor is it different from that.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: zhes smras pas /
analyzed: zhes smras pas /
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: des na rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the effect is not different from the cause, the cause is not annihilated.üîΩNƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / kho bos de skad smra mod kyi khyod kyis de'i rten gyi de kho na khong du ma chud do /
analyzed: bshad pa / kho bos de skad smra mod kyi khyod kyis de'i rten gyi de kho na khong du ma chud do /
translated: I have said this, but you have not understood the reality that is its basis.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po 'gag cing dngos po nyid skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po 'gag cing dngos po nyid skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: In this way, if an entity ceases and entity itself arises,

original: de gnyis de nyid dam gzhan nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de gnyis de nyid dam gzhan nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: how could those two not be the same or different?

original: 'di ltar gal te re zhig rgyus rgyu'i gnas skabs spangs te 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su 'pho bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te re zhig rgyus rgyu'i gnas skabs spangs te 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su 'pho bar gyur na ni /
translated: In this way, if the cause, having abandoned the state of the cause, transforms into the state of the effect,

original: de lta na de nyid rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de lta na de nyid rgyu yin te /
translated: in that case, it is the same cause.

original: de'i gnas skabs gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is merely the transformation of its other states.

original: dper na bro gar mkhan gyis cha lugs gzhan spangs te /
analyzed: dper na bro gar mkhan gyis cha lugs gzhan spangs te /
translated: For example, a dancer discards one costume and

original: cha lugs gzhan lan par byed pa de la cha lugs tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi bro gar mkhan la tha dad pa med pa de cha lugs tha dad par gyur kyang /
analyzed: cha lugs gzhan lan par byed pa de la cha lugs tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi bro gar mkhan la tha dad pa med pa de cha lugs tha dad par gyur kyang /
translated: assumes another. In this case, there is only the difference of costume, but the dancer is not different. Even though the costume is different,

original: de nyid bro gar mkhan yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de nyid bro gar mkhan yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: it is still the dancer.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'phos su zin kyang /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'phos su zin kyang /
translated: In the same way, even though the cause has changed to another state,

original: de nyid rgyu yin na ji ltar de nyid yin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid rgyu yin na ji ltar de nyid yin par mi 'gyur /
translated: how could it not be the cause?

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du rgyu ni gnas skabs gzhan du mi 'pho bar rgyu 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du rgyu ni gnas skabs gzhan du mi 'pho bar rgyu 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: But if you think that the cause does not change to another state, but the cause ceases,

original: rgyu 'gags pa na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: rgyu 'gags pa na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: and when the cause ceases, the effect arises,

original: de lta na yang gang gi tshe gzhan 'gags pa la gzhan skyes pa de'i tshe ji ltar gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang gi tshe gzhan 'gags pa la gzhan skyes pa de'i tshe ji ltar gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur /
translated: then in that case, when one thing ceases, another thing arises. At that time, how could it not be different?

original: kho bo cag la ni dngos po la brten nas gdags pa ngo bo nyid stong pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang gzugs brnyan lta bu rnams la dngos po de gang gir 'gyur te dngos po de gang las gzhan du 'gyur te de nyid dang gzhan nyid du
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni dngos po la brten nas gdags pa ngo bo nyid stong pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang gzugs brnyan lta bu rnams la dngos po de gang gir 'gyur te dngos po de gang las gzhan du 'gyur te de nyid dang gzhan nyid du
translated: But for us, things are dependently imputed, empty of intrinsic reality, like illusions, mirages, and reflections. What would that thing be? From what would that thing be different?

original: 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med do //
translated: It would not be different from that thing.

original: de lta bas na dngos por lta ba yod na rgyu 'gags pa yang skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyun chad pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos por lta ba yod na rgyu 'gags pa yang skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyun chad pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one has the view that things exist, then because the cessation of the cause would not arise, it follows that the continuum would be completely severed.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If things existed by their own intrinsic reality,

original: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: It would not be tenable that they become nonthings.

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis yod na ngo bo nyid yod pa ni dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis yod na ngo bo nyid yod pa ni dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
translated: If things existed by their own intrinsic reality, it would not be tenable that they become nonthings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rang bzhin ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because intrinsic reality does not change into something else.

original: de'i phyir dngos por lta ba yod na rgyu yang 'gag par mi 'thad la 'bras bu yang skye bar mi 'thad de skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ni bkag par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos por lta ba yod na rgyu yang 'gag par mi 'thad la 'bras bu yang skye bar mi 'thad de skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ni bkag par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, if one has the view of real things, it is untenable that causes cease and effects arise, because arising and ceasing are refuted.

original: de la rtag pa kho na'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rtag pa kho na'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the error of eternalism alone would follow.

original: yang gzhan @260b yang ;
analyzed: yang gzhan @260b yang ;
translated: Moreover,

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
translated: at the time of nirvana, there is annihilation.

original: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
analyzed: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of existence is completely pacified.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir chad pa kho na'i skyon du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi ba'i phyir chad pa kho na'i skyon du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of nirvana, because the continuum of existence of an arhat is completely pacified, the error of annihilation alone would follow.

original: de lta bas na srid pa'i rgyun de yod par rtog na yang rtag pa dang chad pa kho na'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de lta bas na srid pa'i rgyun de yod par rtog na yang rtag pa dang chad pa kho na'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro//
translated: Thus, if one conceives that continuum of existence to exist, the error of eternalism and annihilation alone would follow.

original: smras pa / re zhig srid pa'i rgyun ni rab tu grub po //
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig srid pa'i rgyun ni rab tu grub po //
translated: Objection: First, the continuum of existence is well established.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa'i rgyun ldog pa ni kho bo cag la mi gnod pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na de chad par 'gyur kyang sla'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa'i rgyun ldog pa ni kho bo cag la mi gnod pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na de chad par 'gyur kyang sla'o //
translated: But when nirvana is attained, the cessation of the continuum of the arhat‚Äôs existence does not harm us. Therefore, even if it were to cease when nirvana is attained, so be it.

original: bshad pa / khyod kyi srid pa'i rgyun yod na rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de nyid kyang kho bos srid pa'i rgyun yod kyang rtag pa dang chad pa kho na'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes rab tu bstan zin
analyzed: bshad pa / khyod kyi srid pa'i rgyun yod na rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de nyid kyang kho bos srid pa'i rgyun yod kyang rtag pa dang chad pa kho na'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes rab tu bstan zin
translated: You said, ‚ÄúIf the continuum of existence exists, the errors of eternalism and nihilism do not follow,‚Äù but I have already demonstrated that even if the continuum of existence exists, the errors of eternalism and nihilism still follow.

original: to // re zhig srid pa'i rgyun ni rab tu grub po zhes gang smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: to // re zhig srid pa'i rgyun ni rab tu grub po zhes gang smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: You said, ‚ÄúThe continuum of existence is established,‚Äù but that is illogical.

original: srid pa'i rgyun ni ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun ni ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
translated: The continuum of existence is untenable in any way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar ; tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar ; tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
translated: Because that which has ceased

original: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
translated: Does not link to the first existence.

original: da ltar gyi srid pa'i mjug gi sems ni srid pa tha ma'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi srid pa'i mjug gi sems ni srid pa tha ma'o //
translated: The final mind of this existence is the final existence.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa'i sems skye pa'i dang po ni srid pa dang po'o //üîΩde la re zhig srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa'i sems skye pa'i dang po ni srid pa dang po'o // de la re zhig srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de ;
translated: The first mind of the next existence is the first existence.

original: srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, the final existence does not link with the first existence because the final existence has ceased.

original: 'di ltar dngos po 'gags shing med pa las ji ltar dngos po skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po 'gags shing med pa las ji ltar dngos po skye bar 'gyur /
translated: For, how could an entity arise from a nonexistent entity that has ceased?

original: ci ste srid pa tha ma 'gags kyang srid pa dang po skye bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste srid pa tha ma 'gags kyang srid pa dang po skye bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: But if the first existence arose even though the final existence had ceased,

original: de lta na srid pa dang po rgyu med pa las 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta na srid pa dang po rgyu med pa las 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: then the first existence would arise without a cause.

original: de ni mi 'dod de skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is unacceptable because many errors would ensue.

original: de la 'di snyam du srid pa tha ma ma 'gags pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du srid pa tha ma ma 'gags pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that the final existence links with the first existence even though it has not ceased,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩThe final existence does not link with the first existenceüîΩeven though it has not ceased.

original: tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //üîΩsrid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa // srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
translated: The final state of existence would not cease.üîΩThe first state of existence would not link.

original: srid pa tha ma ma 'gags pa yang srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma ma 'gags pa yang srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: The final state of existence that has not ceased would not link with the first state of existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: srid pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error of two states of existence would ensue, and because the error of arising without a cause would ensue.

original: smras pa / srid pa tha ma 'gag pa dang ma 'gags pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med mod kyi 'on kyang 'gag bzhin pa nyid mtshams @261a * //
analyzed: smras pa / srid pa tha ma 'gag pa dang ma 'gags pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med mod kyi 'on kyang 'gag bzhin pa nyid mtshams @261a * //
translated: Objection: The final state of existence that has not ceased and the first state of existence that has not arisen do not link. However, that which is in the process of ceasing links with that which is in the process of arising.

original: sbyor ro // bshad pa /üîΩgal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
analyzed: sbyor ro // bshad pa / gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩIf the final stateüîΩWere to link with the first state

original: dang po skye bar 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: dang po skye bar 'gyur na ni //
translated: While in the process of ceasing,

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
translated: That which is in the process of ceasing would be one thing,

original: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: And that which is in the process of arising would be another.

original: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar gyur na /
translated: If the final state of existence that is in the process of ceasing were to link with the first state of existence, then that which is in the process of ceasing would be one thing, and that which is in the process of arising would be another.

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni phyed 'gags pa'i phyir dang / skye bzhin pa yang byed skyes pa'i phyir de gnyis srid pa gnyis su thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni phyed 'gags pa'i phyir dang / skye bzhin pa yang byed skyes pa'i phyir de gnyis srid pa gnyis su thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: Since that now ceasing is half ceased, and that now arising is half arisen, the error of two existences would ensue,

original: 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that now ceasing and that now arising would exist.

original: smras pa / srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med do zhes bya ba des kho bo la ci bya /
analyzed: smras pa / srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med do zhes bya ba des kho bo la ci bya /
translated: Objection: What does it matter to me if you say that the final existence that is ceasing and now ceasing does not link with the first existence?

original: yod na re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba ni yod de /
analyzed: yod na re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba ni yod de /
translated: If it exists, then first the birth of the first existence exists.

original: de yod pas srid pa'i rgyun yang 'thad do //
analyzed: de yod pas srid pa'i rgyun yang 'thad do //
translated: Since that exists, the continuum of existence is tenable.

original: bshad pa / gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: If that which is now ceasing and that which is now arising Do not make contact,üîΩthen in what

original: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
translated: aggregate will death occur?

original: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: And in that, birth will also occur.

original: lhan cig sbyor ba'ang zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgra ni srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa yang bsdu ba'i don to //üîΩgal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po skye bzhin pa dang lhan cig nyid mtshams sbyor ba'ang yod pa ma yin zhing srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yang srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig sbyor ba'ang zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgra ni srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa yang bsdu ba'i don to // gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po skye bzhin pa dang lhan cig nyid mtshams sbyor ba'ang yod pa ma yin zhing srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yang srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúalso simultaneously‚Äù indicates that the cessation of the final moment of existence and the arising of the first moment of existence are simultaneous.üîΩIf the final moment of existence that is in the process of cessation and the first moment of existence that is in the process of arising do not link together, then the final moment of existence that has ceased would not link together with the first moment of existence.

original: srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yang srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma 'gags pa yang srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: If the final moment of existence that has ceased does not link together with the first moment of existence,üîΩthen the arising of the first moment of existence would occur without a cause.

original: srid pa dang po'i skye ba ni yod do zhes zer na /üîΩde lta na /
analyzed: srid pa dang po'i skye ba ni yod do zhes zer na / de lta na /
translated: If you claim that the arising of the first moment of existence does occur,

original: phung po gang dag kho na la 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag kho na la skye ba yang 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po gang dag kho na la 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag kho na la skye ba yang 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that birth occurs in the very same aggregates in which death occurs.

original: skye ba gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not tenable that birth occurs in any other aggregates.

original: de yang mi 'dod de de lta bas na de gsum ma gtogs par srid pa 'byung bar mi 'thad do //üîΩde ltar dus gsum dag tu yang //
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod de de lta bas na de gsum ma gtogs par srid pa 'byung bar mi 'thad do // de ltar dus gsum dag tu yang //
translated: But that is unacceptable. Therefore, apart from those three, the occurrence of existence is untenable.üîΩThus, the continuum of existence

original: srid pa'i rgyun ni mi rigs na //üîΩdus gsum dag tu gang med pa //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun ni mi rigs na // dus gsum dag tu gang med pa //
translated: is not tenable in the three times.üîΩHow could that which does not exist

original: de ni ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //
translated: in the three times be the continuum of existence?

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus gsum dag tu yang srid pa'i rgyun mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus gsum dag tu yang srid pa'i rgyun mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, when thoroughly investigated in this way, since it is untenable that the final phase of existence that has ceased, not ceased, or is ceasing links with the first phase of existence, the continuum of existence is not tenable in the three times.

original: dus gsum dag tu srid pa'i rgyun gang med pa de dang ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun du 'thad /
analyzed: dus gsum dag tu srid pa'i rgyun gang med pa de dang ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun du 'thad /
translated: How could that which does not exist in the three times be the continuum of existence?

original: srid pa'i rgyun yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the continuum of existence does not exist,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could emergence and destruction exist?

original: 'byung ba dang @261b 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin na khyod kyi dus la sogs pa dag 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang @261b 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin na khyod kyi dus la sogs pa dag 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If emergence and destruction do not exist, how could your time, etc., be established?

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'o /üîΩ// / smras pa /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'o / // / smras pa /
translated: The twenty-first chapter

original: srid pa'i rgyun ni yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun ni yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Objection: The continuum of existence definitely exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Tathagata exists.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bcom ldan 'das dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bcom ldan 'das dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yod do //
translated: The Tathagata is the Bhagavan, the Arhat, the Completely Enlightened One.

original: des bskal pa grangs med pa dag gis byang chub yang dag par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: des bskal pa grangs med pa dag gis byang chub yang dag par bsgrubs te /
translated: He perfectly accomplished enlightenment over countless eons.

original: de ltar yang mdo sde gzhan dag las de'i tshe de'i dus na nga bram ze'i khye'u mig bzang zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo sde gzhan dag las de'i tshe de'i dus na nga bram ze'i khye'u mig bzang zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, in other sutras he said, ‚ÄúAt that time, at that juncture, I was the brahman youth Sunetra.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na nga rgyal po nga las nu zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na nga rgyal po nga las nu zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time, at that juncture, I was King Mandhatr.‚Äù

original: srid pa'i rgyun med na de mi 'thad pas de'i phyir srid pa'i rgyun ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun med na de mi 'thad pas de'i phyir srid pa'i rgyun ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: If the continuum of existence did not exist, this would be untenable. Therefore the continuum of existence definitely exists.üîΩNƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa nyid 'thad na ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa nyid 'thad na ni /
translated: If the TathƒÅgata himself were tenable,

original: srid pa'i rgyun yang yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun yang yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: And if the continuum of existence exists,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mi 'thad pas de'i srid pa'i rgyun yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mi 'thad pas de'i srid pa'i rgyun yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could the TathƒÅgata exist?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /üîΩde phung po rnams nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na / de phung po rnams nyid dam /
translated: If the so-called TathƒÅgata exists,

original: phung po rnams las gzhan zhig yin grang na /üîΩde la ; sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan zhig yin grang na / de la ; sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: is he the aggregates or is he other than the aggregates?üîΩHe is not the body, nor is he other than the body.

original: de la sku med de der med //
analyzed: de la sku med de der med //
translated: He does not exist in the body, nor does the body exist in him.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min ;
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not possess a body.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
translated: What is the TathƒÅgata?

original: re zhig phung po rnams nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phung po rnams nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: The aggregates are not the TathƒÅgata.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: phung po rnams 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar len pa dag gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar len pa dag gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the Tathagata would be impermanent because the aggregates are subject to arising and disintegration, and because it is untenable that the appropriator and that appropriated are identical.

original: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan pa phung po med pa'i chos logs shig na yang med de /
analyzed: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan pa phung po med pa'i chos logs shig na yang med de /
translated: The Tathagata does not exist as a different object from the aggregates, as a phenomenon devoid of aggregates.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: phung po mi rtag pa rnams las chos mi mthun pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid yin na gzung du yod par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung po mi rtag pa rnams las chos mi mthun pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid yin na gzung du yod par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that he would be permanent, because he would be a phenomenon that is not in keeping with the impermanence of the aggregates, and because it would follow, absurdly, that he would be apprehended, for if he were different, he would have to be apprehended.

original: gzung ngu yang med pas de'i phyir phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ngu yang med pas de'i phyir phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yang ma yin no //
translated: But he is not apprehended, and for that reason the Tathagata is not different from the aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams gangs la shing ljon pa'i nags tshal bzhin du med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams gangs la shing ljon pa'i nags tshal bzhin du med de /
translated: The Tathagata does not exist in the aggregates, as a forest exists in trees.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrten dang brten pa gzhan ma yin pa'i @262a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rten dang brten pa gzhan ma yin pa'i @262a * //
translated: Why?

original: phyir mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be impermanent, since it would not be different from the basis and the dependent.

original: phung po rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa shing ljon pa'i nags tshal na seng ge bzhin du med de /
analyzed: phung po rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa shing ljon pa'i nags tshal na seng ge bzhin du med de /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not exist in the aggregates in the way that a lion exists in a forest of trees.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skyon bstan ma thag pa nyid du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon bstan ma thag pa nyid du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the previously explained faults would ensue.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang shing ljon pa'i snying po dang ldan pa bzhin du ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang shing ljon pa'i snying po dang ldan pa bzhin du ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not possess the aggregates in the way that a tree possesses a heartwood.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fault of impermanence would ensue, since he would not be different from the aggregates.

original: de ltar rnam pa lngas btsal na de bzhin gshegs pa nye bar len pa la mi srid na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lngas btsal na de bzhin gshegs pa nye bar len pa la mi srid na /
translated: Thus, when you search in these five ways, the TathƒÅgata is not possible in the appropriated aggregates.

original: khyod kyis gang gis srid pa'i rgyun yod par yongs su brtags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de gang zhig yin pa smros shig / smras pa /üîΩci kho bo phung po rnams nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: khyod kyis gang gis srid pa'i rgyun yod par yongs su brtags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de gang zhig yin pa smros shig / smras pa / ci kho bo phung po rnams nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: You should state which TathƒÅgata you imagine to exist in the continuum of existence.

original: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan no zhes smra'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan no zhes smra'am /
translated: Do I say that the TathƒÅgata is the aggregates or that the TathƒÅgata is different from the aggregates?

original: ci'i phyir khyod kho bo la rtag pa'am mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod kho bo la rtag pa'am mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon 'dogs par byed /
translated: Why do you attribute the error of permanence or impermanence to me?

original: kho bo ni phung po rnams la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa gdags par bya ba yin par smra bas /
analyzed: kho bo ni phung po rnams la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa gdags par bya ba yin par smra bas /
translated: I say that the TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates.

original: brten nas gdags par bya ba ni //
analyzed: brten nas gdags par bya ba ni //
translated: I say that what is dependently imputed

original: nye bar len pa las de nyid dam gzhan nyid du mi smra'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa las de nyid dam gzhan nyid du mi smra'o //
translated: is neither identical to nor different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: de'i phyir de nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur la gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur la gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is not to be expressed as the same, the error of impermanence does not arise, and because it is not to be expressed as different, the error of permanence does not arise.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod legs par sbyar ba'i phyed kyis gar byed dam /üîΩkhyod brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa gdags par yang smra la /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod legs par sbyar ba'i phyed kyis gar byed dam / khyod brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa gdags par yang smra la /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Do you dance with half of a well-prepared meal?üîΩYou say that the TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las yang 'grub par yang 'dod ko //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las yang 'grub par yang 'dod ko //
translated: and you assert that the TathƒÅgata is established from his own nature.

original: 'o na / gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
analyzed: 'o na / gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
translated: If the Buddha is not established from his own nature

original: brten nas ngo bo nyid las med /
analyzed: brten nas ngo bo nyid las med /
translated: in dependence on the aggregates,

original: gal te sangs rgyas phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin na /
translated: if the Buddha is to be imputed in dependence on the aggregates,

original: de'i don ni sangs rgyas ngo bo nyid las med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i don ni sangs rgyas ngo bo nyid las med pa ma yin nam /
translated: then does this not mean that the Buddha does not exist from his own nature?

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid las yod pa la ni yang brten nas gdags pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid las yod pa la ni yang brten nas gdags pas ci bya ste /
translated: In that case, what is the point of imputing him in dependence if he exists from his own nature?

original: de'i ngo bo nyid gang kho na yin pa de kho nas gdags par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid gang kho na yin pa de kho nas gdags par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is only by its own intrinsic reality that it is to be designated.

original: gang gi phyir de ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir nye bar len pas gang gdags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir nye bar len pas gang gdags par bya ba ste /
translated: Since it has no intrinsic reality, it is designated by appropriation.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata does not exist by intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //
translated: How can that which does not exist by intrinsic reality

original: de gzhan dngos las ga la yod //
analyzed: de gzhan dngos las ga la yod //
translated: Exist by extrinsic reality?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang ngo bo nyid las med pa de dag gzhan gang las yod par sems na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang ngo bo nyid las med pa de dag gzhan gang las yod par sems na /
translated: If you think that the TathƒÅgata, who does not exist by intrinsic reality, exists by extrinsic reality,

original: @262b smras pa /
analyzed: @262b smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gzhan gyi dngos po las te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po las te /
translated: He exists by extrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nye bar len pa gzhan du gyur la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyi dngos po las yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nye bar len pa gzhan du gyur la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyi dngos po las yod do //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is to be designated in dependence on the transformation of appropriation. Therefore, the TathƒÅgata exists by extrinsic reality.üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos brten nas //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos brten nas //
translated: That which is dependent on extrinsic reality

original: de dag nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de dag nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Is untenable as such.

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba de ni bdag nyid yod do zhes brjod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba de ni bdag nyid yod do zhes brjod par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable to say that which is imputed in dependence on other things exists by way of its own intrinsic reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang las ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig bdag nyid med pa de //
analyzed: rang las ma grub pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig bdag nyid med pa de //
translated: Because it is not established from itself.üîΩHow could that which lacks intrinsic reality

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur //
translated: Become a TathƒÅgata?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig rang gi bdag nyid med pa de nyid nye bar len pa gzhan du gyur pas gdags par bya na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig rang gi bdag nyid med pa de nyid nye bar len pa gzhan du gyur pas gdags par bya na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur /
translated: If that which lacks intrinsic reality is designated as a TathƒÅgata due to the transformation of other appropriated aggregates, how could it become a TathƒÅgata?

original: gal te de rang gi bdag nyid med par nye bar len pa la brten nas bdag nyid yod par 'gyur na ni /üîΩde lta na nye bar len pa la brten te skyes par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te de rang gi bdag nyid med par nye bar len pa la brten nas bdag nyid yod par 'gyur na ni / de lta na nye bar len pa la brten te skyes par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: If it becomes existent by way of its own intrinsic reality in dependence on other appropriated aggregates,
