original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would arise in dependence on appropriated aggregates. But that is unacceptable because the error of impermanence and so on would ensue.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If it lacks intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur //üîΩngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs de bzhin gshegs de gang //
analyzed: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur // ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs de bzhin gshegs de gang //
translated: How could the TathƒÅgata be a different entity?üîΩApart from entityness and a different entity, what TathƒÅgata is there?

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: If the TathƒÅgata is entityness,

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: he would not be nonexistent.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could the TathƒÅgata be a different entity?

original: 'di ltar gang ngo bo nyid las gzhan yin pa de gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang ngo bo nyid las gzhan yin pa de gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya na /
translated: In this way, that which is different from entityness is called a different entity.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa de gang las gzhan gyi dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa de gang las gzhan gyi dngos por 'gyur /
translated: But if he is without entityness, from what would a different entity come?

original: de lta bas na gzhan gyi dngos po yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan gyi dngos po yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, a different entity also does not exist.

original: 'o na ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs par de bzhin gshegs pa de gang yin pa dang gang gis gdags par bya ba de smros shig / smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs par de bzhin gshegs pa de gang yin pa dang gang gis gdags par bya ba de smros shig / smras pa /
translated: Apart from entityness and a different entity, tell us what the TathƒÅgata is and by what he is designated.

original: khyod brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don rnam par mi shes par mi rigs pa mang po de snyed cig smra ste /
analyzed: khyod brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don rnam par mi shes par mi rigs pa mang po de snyed cig smra ste /
translated: You say so many things that are illogical because you do not understand the meaning of dependent origination.

original: gzhan gyi tshig la co 'dri ba tsam gyis ni de kho na'i don yongs su shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig la co 'dri ba tsam gyis ni de kho na'i don yongs su shes par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot understand the meaning of reality merely by criticizing the words of others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba gang yin pa de la ci de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las yod dam 'on te gzhan gyi dngos po las yod ces bya ba'i tshig de'i glan kar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba gang yin pa de la ci de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las yod dam 'on te gzhan gyi dngos po las yod ces bya ba'i tshig de'i glan kar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And it is not possible to object to the statement, ‚ÄúThat which is to be designated in dependence on the TathƒÅgata exists,‚Äù by saying, ‚ÄúDoes the TathƒÅgata exist due to his own nature or does he exist due to the nature of another?‚Äù

original: bshad pa / 'jig rten na /üîΩ'dre yis bya ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'jig rten na / 'dre yis bya ba gang yin pa //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds,üîΩThe childish do what

original: de ni byis pa dag byed do //
analyzed: de ni byis pa dag byed do //
translated: demons make them do.

original: zhes brjod pa de ni bden pa @263a * //üîΩkho na ste /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa de ni bden pa @263a * // kho na ste /
translated: This statement is true.

original: kho ba ni brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don rnam par mi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: kho ba ni brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don rnam par mi shes pa yin la /
translated: You do not understand the meaning of dependent designation, but I do.

original: khyod ni ma yin pa lta zhig / khyod kyis gang dag la de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa'i phung po rnams ni nye bar len pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: khyod ni ma yin pa lta zhig / khyod kyis gang dag la de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa'i phung po rnams ni nye bar len pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: The aggregates that you impute to be the TathƒÅgata do not exist as the appropriated.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te phung po ma brten par //
analyzed: gal te phung po ma brten par //
translated: If the self were not dependent on the aggregates,üîΩ

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //
translated: If the TathƒÅgata exists without depending on the aggregates,üîΩthen he would be an existent that depends on the aggregates,

original: de ni dag dod rten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni dag dod rten 'gyur zhing //
translated: and he would come to exist in dependence on them.

original: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag yang skyes par gyur la phung po rnams kyis de gsal ba tsam bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod cing /üîΩde phung po rnams nye bar len par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag yang skyes par gyur la phung po rnams kyis de gsal ba tsam bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod cing / de phung po rnams nye bar len par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the TathƒÅgata were to exist in some way without depending on the aggregates, and if he were to appropriate the aggregates,

original: de lta na ni de bzhin gshegs pa brten nas yod par 'gyur la rag go //
analyzed: de lta na ni de bzhin gshegs pa brten nas yod par 'gyur la rag go //
translated: then in that case the TathƒÅgata would exist in dependence on the aggregates.

original: de yang skyes par gyur la phung po rnams kyis de gsal ba tsam zhig byed par 'gyur du ni /üîΩphung po rnams la ma brten par //
analyzed: de yang skyes par gyur la phung po rnams kyis de gsal ba tsam zhig byed par 'gyur du ni / phung po rnams la ma brten par //
translated: And if the TathƒÅgata were to exist in some way and the aggregates were to make him manifest,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
translated: then the TathƒÅgata would not exist without depending on the aggregates.

original: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
translated: If the TathƒÅgata does not exist without depending on the aggregates,

original: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
translated: how could he appropriate the aggregates?

original: phung po rnams la ma brten par de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: phung po rnams la ma brten par de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang mi 'thad de /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not tenable in any way without depending on the aggregates.

original: gang phung po rnams la ma brten par med na /
analyzed: gang phung po rnams la ma brten par med na /
translated: If he does not exist without depending on the aggregates,üîΩthen how could he appropriate the aggregates?

original: med pa des ji ltar phung po rnams nye bar len par 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa des ji ltar phung po rnams nye bar len par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist appropriate the aggregates?

original: smras pa / gzhung lugs dang 'gal ba de bshad de ci rung /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhung lugs dang 'gal ba de bshad de ci rung /
translated: Objection: What is the point of explaining that contradiction with scripture?

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gsungs pas /
translated: In this way, the BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúCyclic existence has no beginning or end.‚Äù

original: de la nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blangs pa dag snga phyi yod par 'thad par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blangs pa dag snga phyi yod par 'thad par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be tenable that the appropriator and that appropriated exist in a prior and subsequent order?

original: de ni rtag tu nye bar len pa dang bcas pas gdags par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu nye bar len pa dang bcas pas gdags par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is always associated with appropriation, it is to be designated.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blangs pa dag snga phyi yod par mi 'thad na ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blangs pa dag snga phyi yod par mi 'thad na ni /
translated: If cyclic existence has no beginning or end, then it is untenable that the appropriator and that appropriated exist in a prior and subsequent order.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nye bar len pa po yin la phung po rnams ni nye bar blang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nye bar len pa po yin la phung po rnams ni nye bar blang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Then is it not untenable to say, ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata is the appropriator and the aggregates are that appropriated‚Äù?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa //
translated: Because: That which is not appropriated

original: nye bar len par cis mi 'gyur //üîΩnye bar len pa med pa yi //
analyzed: nye bar len par cis mi 'gyur // nye bar len pa med pa yi //
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt it be appropriated?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not existüîΩWithout appropriation.

original: 'di la nye bar blangs pa yin pas nye bar len pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'di la nye bar blangs pa yin pas nye bar len pa zhes bya la /
translated: Here, appropriation is called ‚Äúappropriation‚Äù because it is appropriated.

original: nye bar len par byed pas nye bar len pa po zhes bya bas /
analyzed: nye bar len par byed pas nye bar len pa po zhes bya bas /
translated: The appropriator is called ‚Äúappropriator‚Äù because he appropriates.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa pos nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa ni nye bar len pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa pos nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa ni nye bar len pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, that which is not appropriated by the appropriator is not appropriation.

original: nye bar blangs pa nye bar len par mi byed pa @263b yang nye bar len pa po ma yin no //üîΩ'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med na 'di ni nye bar blangs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar blangs pa nye bar len par mi byed pa @263b yang nye bar len pa po ma yin no // 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med na 'di ni nye bar blangs pa'o //
translated: And that which is appropriated but does not appropriate is not the appropriator.

original: 'di ni nye bar len par byed pa'o zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len par byed pa'o zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: If sa·πÉsƒÅra has no beginning and no end, then it is untenable to say, ‚ÄúThis is appropriated,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is the appropriator.‚Äù

original: de ltar snga phyi med na khyod kyi phung po rnams ji ltar nye bar blang ba yin pa dang / khyod kyis yongs su brtags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de ji ltar nye bar len pa po yin pa de smros shig / de lta bas na snga phyi med na nye bar len pa po yang mi 'thad pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar snga phyi med na khyod kyi phung po rnams ji ltar nye bar blang ba yin pa dang / khyod kyis yongs su brtags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de ji ltar nye bar len pa po yin pa de smros shig / de lta bas na snga phyi med na nye bar len pa po yang mi 'thad pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, if there is no temporal sequence, then the appropriator is untenable,

original: nye bar blang ba yang mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yang mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: and the appropriated is also untenable.

original: smras pa / de ni 'thad de /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni 'thad de /
translated: Objection: That is tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it cannot be said to be identical or different.

original: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du mi brjod do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du mi brjod do //
translated: The appropriator and the appropriated cannot be said to be identical or different.

original: re zhig de nyid du mi brjod de byed pa po'i tshig tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig de nyid du mi brjod de byed pa po'i tshig tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, they cannot be said to be identical because the terms of the agent are different.

original: gzhan nyid du yang mi brjod dam so sor 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du yang mi brjod dam so sor 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They also cannot be said to be different because they are not established separately.

original: de lta bas na de gnyi ga yang yod de de nyid dang gzhan nyid du ni brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de gnyi ga yang yod de de nyid dang gzhan nyid du ni brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, both exist, but they cannot be described as either the same or different.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod mdza' bshes kyi blos dgra bo dpang du len tam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod mdza' bshes kyi blos dgra bo dpang du len tam /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Do you take an enemy to be a witness out of a sense of friendship?

original: khyod gang kho nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blangs ba dag rab tu 'grub par mi 'thad pa de kho nas de dag rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir rtsom par byed ko //üîΩ'di ltar gal te nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po zhig yod par gyur na gcig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: khyod gang kho nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blangs ba dag rab tu 'grub par mi 'thad pa de kho nas de dag rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir rtsom par byed ko // 'di ltar gal te nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po zhig yod par gyur na gcig pa nyid dam /
translated: You are trying to establish both the appropriator and that which is to be appropriated by means of precisely that which is untenable.

original: gzhan nyid du 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
translated: In this way, if that which is to be appropriated and the appropriator exist, there is no doubt that they would be the same or different.

original: gang dag gcig pa nyid du yang yod pa ma yin la gzhan nyid du yang yod pa ma yin pa de dag gzhan du ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag gcig pa nyid du yang yod pa ma yin la gzhan nyid du yang yod pa ma yin pa de dag gzhan du ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: But those that do not exist as the same or different, how could they exist in any other way?

original: de lta bas na nye bar blang ba yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid la nye bar len pa po yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar blang ba yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid la nye bar len pa po yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that which is to be appropriated does not exist, and the appropriator also does not exist.

original: tha snyad kyi dbang gis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blangs pa dag rjod par byed na yang de nyid kyi ma yin pa gzhan nyid kyang ma yin par brjod dgos te de ni nges pa kho nar de ltar blta'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dbang gis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blangs pa dag rjod par byed na yang de nyid kyi ma yin pa gzhan nyid kyang ma yin par brjod dgos te de ni nges pa kho nar de ltar blta'o //
translated: If you say that the appropriator and that appropriated exist due to the power of nominal convention, then you must say that they are neither identical nor different. This is definitely the way to view them.

original: gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa bdag dang nye bar len pa bdag med pa dag ji ltar gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa bdag dang nye bar len pa bdag med pa dag ji ltar gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the appropriator and that appropriated, the TathƒÅgata and the self, not be different?

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /üîΩgang phyir gzugs la bdag med pa //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang / gang phyir gzugs la bdag med pa //
translated: ƒÄryadeva also says:üîΩBecause form does not exist in self,

original: de phyir gzugs las bdag gzhan 'gyur //üîΩgrang dang tsha ba tha dad nyid //
analyzed: de phyir gzugs las bdag gzhan 'gyur // grang dang tsha ba tha dad nyid //
translated: the self is different from form.üîΩIt is not tenable to say

original: med ces brjod par mi rung bzhin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: med ces brjod par mi rung bzhin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: that heat and cold do not exist.üîΩBut if the appropriator exists,

original: ci ste yang nye bar len pa po zhig yod par gyur na de lta na yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang nye bar len pa po zhig yod par gyur na de lta na yang /
translated: then even in that case,

original: rnam pa lngas ni btsal byas na //üîΩgang zhig de nyid gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni btsal byas na // gang zhig de nyid gzhan nyid du //
translated: having been sought in five ways,

original: med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de//
analyzed: med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de//
translated: the TathƒÅgata who does not exist as identical or different

original: @264a * // nye bar len pas ji ltar gdags //
analyzed: @264a * // nye bar len pas ji ltar gdags //
translated: is imputed due to appropriation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang nye bar len pa gang gis gdags par bya ba de nyid la rnam pa lngas btsal na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nye bar len pa la med na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa yod doüîΩzhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang nye bar len pa gang gis gdags par bya ba de nyid la rnam pa lngas btsal na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nye bar len pa la med na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes brjod par bya /
translated: Since the appropriated aggregates do not exist in the fivefold way, how could the TathƒÅgata exist?

original: de lta bas na brten nas gdags pa dang yod pa nyid kyang mi 'thad do //üîΩsmras pa / ji srid du nye bar len pa zhes bya ba phung po lnga po 'di /
analyzed: de lta bas na brten nas gdags pa dang yod pa nyid kyang mi 'thad do // smras pa / ji srid du nye bar len pa zhes bya ba phung po lnga po 'di /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the TathƒÅgata exists in dependence on the appropriated aggregates.

original: sngon du dmigs par 'gyur ba de srid du ji ltar med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon du dmigs par 'gyur ba de srid du ji ltar med par 'gyur te /
translated: Objection: As long as the so-called appropriated aggregates, the fivefold collection of appropriated phenomena, are observed, how could they not exist?

original: de'i phyir re zhig nye bar len pa ni yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig nye bar len pa ni yod do //
translated: Therefore, first the appropriated aggregates exist.

original: kha lo sgyur ba med par shing rta mi 'gro bas 'di la nye bar len pa po yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha lo sgyur ba med par shing rta mi 'gro bas 'di la nye bar len pa po yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since a chariot does not move without a charioteer, the appropriator also exists.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod chu bo shugs drag pos khyer ba na rtsa drungs phyung la 'ju'am /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod chu bo shugs drag pos khyer ba na rtsa drungs phyung la 'ju'am /
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: When you are carried away by a strong current, do you grasp at a blade of grass?

original: khyod nye bar blangs pas nye bar len pa po rab tu bsgrub par 'dod ko //
analyzed: khyod nye bar blangs pas nye bar len pa po rab tu bsgrub par 'dod ko //
translated: You assert that the appropriator is established by the appropriated.

original: gang gi tshe /üîΩgang zhig nye bar blang pa de //
analyzed: gang gi tshe / gang zhig nye bar blang pa de //
translated: But when

original: de ni ngo bo nyid las med //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid las med //
translated: The appropriated does not exist through its own intrinsic reality.

original: nye bar blang ba gang yod do snyam du sems pa de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba gang yod do snyam du sems pa de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: The appropriated that you think exists is also essenceless because it arises in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: smras pa / de ni re zhig yod de gal te bdag gi dngos po las yod pa ma yin yang gzhan gyi dngos po las yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / de ni re zhig yod de gal te bdag gi dngos po las yod pa ma yin yang gzhan gyi dngos po las yod do //
translated: Objection: First, it exists. Even though it does not exist through its own intrinsic reality, it exists through the intrinsic reality of another.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / bdag gi dngos las gang med pa //
analyzed: bshad pa / bdag gi dngos las gang med pa //
translated: Just as it does not exist through its own intrinsic reality,

original: de bzhin dngos las yod re skan //üîΩnye bar len pa gang bdag gi dngos po las med pa de gzhan gyi dngos po las yod par 'gyur re skan /
analyzed: de bzhin dngos las yod re skan // nye bar len pa gang bdag gi dngos po las med pa de gzhan gyi dngos po las yod par 'gyur re skan /
translated: So it does not exist through the intrinsic reality of another.üîΩThe appropriated does not exist through its own intrinsic reality. How could it exist through the intrinsic reality of another?

original: gang gi tshe bdag gi dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na nye bar len pa ni bdag gi dngos po las yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gi dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na nye bar len pa ni bdag gi dngos po las yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: If the self existed through its own intrinsic reality, the appropriated would not exist through the intrinsic reality of the self.

original: de'i phyir de las gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist in any other way.

original: gzhan med na ji ltar gzhan las yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan med na ji ltar gzhan las yod par 'gyur /
translated: If it does not exist as something other, how could it exist as something other?

original: de lta bas na nye bar len pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar len pa ni /
translated: Thus, appropriation

original: gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: does not exist as something other.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes gang smras pa de yang rang gi sems kun tu rmongs pa'i skyon gyis sgyu ma dang rmi lam mthong ba bzhin du mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes gang smras pa de yang rang gi sems kun tu rmongs pa'i skyon gyis sgyu ma dang rmi lam mthong ba bzhin du mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: As for the claim that it is perceived directly, that is due to the error of the mind‚Äôs confusion, like the perception of a magical illusion or a dream.

original: 'di la yang dag par cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di la yang dag par cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is not the slightest bit of reality to that.

original: 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa de spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa de spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the conception that this is real,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dbu brdos pa dang chu'i chu bur dang smig rgyu dang chu shing gi phung po dang sgyu ma'i dpe dag bka' stsal cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dbu brdos pa dang chu'i chu bur dang smig rgyu dang chu shing gi phung po dang sgyu ma'i dpe dag bka' stsal cing /
translated: the Buddha used the examples of a mirage, a magical illusion, a dream, a mass of foam, and a plantain tree trunk.

original: sgyu ma 'di ni byis pa 'drid pa'o zhes kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: sgyu ma 'di ni byis pa 'drid pa'o zhes kyang gsungs te /
translated: He also said, ‚ÄúThis magical illusion deceives fools.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since they do not exist,

original: de ltar nyer blang nyer len po //
analyzed: de ltar nyer blang nyer len po //
translated: Thus the appropriated and appropriator

original: rnam @264b pa kun gyis stong pa yin //
analyzed: rnam @264b pa kun gyis stong pa yin //
translated: Are empty in every respect.

original: stong pas de bzhin gshegs stong pa //
analyzed: stong pas de bzhin gshegs stong pa //
translated: Since they are empty, the TathƒÅgata is empty.

original: ji lta bur na 'dogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na 'dogs par 'gyur //
translated: How could he be imputed?

original: de ltar gang gi phyir nye bar len pa ngo bo nyid las kyang yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir nye bar len pa stong pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir nye bar len pa ngo bo nyid las kyang yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir nye bar len pa stong pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because the appropriated does not exist due to its own intrinsic reality and it does not exist due to the reality of another, therefore the appropriated is empty.

original: gang gi phyir nye bar len pa po yang rnam pa kun gyis yongs su brtags na ngo bo nyid las kyang yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir nye bar len pa po yang stong pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar len pa po yang rnam pa kun gyis yongs su brtags na ngo bo nyid las kyang yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir nye bar len pa po yang stong pa yin no //
translated: Because the appropriator also is not found due to its own intrinsic reality and it does not exist due to the reality of another, when it is thoroughly investigated in every respect, therefore the appropriator is also empty.

original: de'i phyir khyod dbu brdos pa dang / chu'i chu bur dang smig rgyu dang chu shing gi phung po dang sgyu ma ltar snying po med cing ngo bo nyid stong pa'i nye bar len pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod dbu brdos pa dang / chu'i chu bur dang smig rgyu dang chu shing gi phung po dang sgyu ma ltar snying po med cing ngo bo nyid stong pa'i nye bar len pas /
translated: Therefore, like a mirage, a magical display, a mass of foam, a plantain trunk, and an illusion, your appropriated aggregates are insubstantial and empty of intrinsic reality.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang rmi lam dang gzugs brnyan dang dri za'i grong khyer ltar snying po med cing ngo bo nyid stong pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes ji ltar 'dogs par byed pa je smros shig / de lta bas na re zhig rang gi phyogs
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang rmi lam dang gzugs brnyan dang dri za'i grong khyer ltar snying po med cing ngo bo nyid stong pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes ji ltar 'dogs par byed pa je smros shig / de lta bas na re zhig rang gi phyogs
translated: Therefore, first of all, you should reflect on which of these twoüîΩis ignorant of the meaning of dependent imputation: one who, attached toüîΩhis own position, imputes existence in dependence on something, and oneüîΩwho, having abandoned existence and nonexistence in the middle way,üîΩestablishes it in dependence on something.

original: la chags pa thod la ci gang brten nas yod par 'dogs pa dang / gang brten nas yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid spangs te dbu mar bsgrubs pa 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: la chags pa thod la ci gang brten nas yod par 'dogs pa dang / gang brten nas yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid spangs te dbu mar bsgrubs pa 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
translated: ‚Äú This exists, therefore that arises,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis does not exist, therefore thatüîΩdoes not arise.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the meaning of ‚Äúdependent imputation‚Äù is that any entity that

original: 'di med pas 'di mi 'byung ngo zhes 'dogs par byed pa de gnyis las gang brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don rnam par mi shes pa yin pa de soms shig / de lta bas na brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don ni dngos po gang brten nas
analyzed: 'di med pas 'di mi 'byung ngo zhes 'dogs par byed pa de gnyis las gang brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don rnam par mi shes pa yin pa de soms shig / de lta bas na brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don ni dngos po gang brten nas
translated: is imputed in dependence on another is not that other entity.

original: gdags par bya ba de ni rnam pa thams cad du ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir yod pa dang med par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba de ni rnam pa thams cad du ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir yod pa dang med par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid yin te /
translated: That which is imputed is not to be described as existent or nonexistent because it is empty of essence in every respect.

original: tha snyad kyi tshig la ni skyon med do //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi tshig la ni skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault in conventional expressions.

original: smras pa / gal te de ltar de dag thams cad stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ba yin na 'o na khyod bag tsha ba med par gsang bstod de /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te de ltar de dag thams cad stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ba yin na 'o na khyod bag tsha ba med par gsang bstod de /
translated: Objection: If it is not to be said that ‚Äúall of these are empty,‚Äù then why do you, with such confidence, proclaim

original: 'di dag thams cad stong ngo zhes smra'am /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad stong ngo zhes smra'am /
translated: ‚ÄúAll of these are empty‚Äù?üîΩResponse: To say ‚Äúit is not to be said that ‚Äòall of these are empty‚Äô‚Äù is to say very little.

original: bshad pa / stong ngo zhes brjod par mi bya ba yin na zhes bya ba ni shin tu nyung ngu zhig brjod pa yin te /üîΩstong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de //üîΩmi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
analyzed: bshad pa / stong ngo zhes brjod par mi bya ba yin na zhes bya ba ni shin tu nyung ngu zhig brjod pa yin te / stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de // mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
translated: It is not to be said that ‚Äúall of these are empty,‚ÄùüîΩNor is it to be said that ‚Äúall of these are not empty.‚ÄùüîΩNor is it to be said that ‚Äúall of these are both empty and not empty,‚ÄùüîΩNor is it to be said that ‚Äúall of these are neither empty nor not empty.‚Äù

original: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
translated: It is to be said that ‚Äúall of these are empty‚Äù

original: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya //üîΩstong ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya // stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
translated: For the sake of designation.üîΩIt is not to be said that ‚Äúall of these are empty.‚Äù

original: mi stong ngo zhes kyang mi bya /
analyzed: mi stong ngo zhes kyang mi bya /
translated: Nor is it to be said that ‚Äúall of these are not empty.‚Äù

original: stong pa dang mi stong pa dang / stong pa yang ma yin mi stong pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang mi stong pa dang / stong pa yang ma yin mi stong pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be said that it is empty or not empty, or that it is both or neither.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa spang pa'i phyir dang / @265a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa spang pa'i phyir dang / @265a * //
translated: They are to be expressed in order to abandon unreal imagination andüîΩfor the purpose of designating the ultimate reality.

original: don dam pa'i de kho na gdags pa'i don du ni de dag brjod par bya ste 'og nas kyang /üîΩtha snyad la ni ma brten par //üîΩdam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus //
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na gdags pa'i don du ni de dag brjod par bya ste 'og nas kyang / tha snyad la ni ma brten par // dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus //
translated: And later on it says:üîΩThe ultimate truth cannot be taughtüîΩwithout relying on conventional expressions.

original: dam pa'i don la ma brten par //
analyzed: dam pa'i don la ma brten par //
translated: Without relying on the ultimate truth,

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'thob mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'thob mi 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo /
translated: nirvƒÅ·πáa cannot be attained.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva also says:

original: gal te dngos po rang bzhin yod //
analyzed: gal te dngos po rang bzhin yod //
translated: If things have intrinsic reality,

original: stong mthong yon tan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: stong mthong yon tan ci zhig yod //
translated: what is the use of seeing emptiness?

original: rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
analyzed: rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
translated: Seeing the bondage of conceptualization,

original: 'dir ni de nyid dgag par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni de nyid dgag par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: here that is to be refuted.

original: smras pa / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las kyang yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las kyang yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Objection: If the TathƒÅgata does not exist from his own intrinsic reality, nor does he exist from the reality of another,

original: ci'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang / mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs par brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang / mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs par brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad /
translated: why did you say, ‚ÄúHe should not be described as permanent, impermanent, and so on, nor as having an end, being endless, and so on‚Äù?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not exist.

original: zhes gsal ba kho nar brjod par bya ba'i rigs pa snyam bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes gsal ba kho nar brjod par bya ba'i rigs pa snyam bshad pa /
translated: It is reasonable to state this clearly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brten nas gdags par bya ba gang yin pa de /üîΩyod do zhe'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brten nas gdags par bya ba gang yin pa de / yod do zhe'am /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the appropriated aggregates.üîΩHow can it be reasonable to say, ‚ÄúHe exists‚Äù

original: med do zhes ji ltar brjod par rigs /
analyzed: med do zhes ji ltar brjod par rigs /
translated: or ‚ÄúHe does not exist‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar gal te de bzhin gshegs pa zhig yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te de bzhin gshegs pa zhig yod par gyur na /
translated: In this way, if the TathƒÅgata existed,

original: nye bar len pa med pa yang yod pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa yang yod pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: it would be reasonable that he would exist without appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa med par ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med par ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But he does not exist without appropriation.

original: gang nye bar len pa med pa ni yod pa ma yin pa de ji ltar yod do zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: gang nye bar len pa med pa ni yod pa ma yin pa de ji ltar yod do zhes brjod par bya /
translated: But how can that which does not exist due to the absence of appropriation be said to exist?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang la brten nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang la brten nas /
translated: How can it be said that the TathƒÅgata

original: gdags par bya ba de ji ltar med do zhes kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba de ji ltar med do zhes kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: does not exist?

original: 'di ltar au dum b'a ra'i me tog med pa ni gdags su med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar au dum b'a ra'i me tog med pa ni gdags su med do //
translated: For example, the nonexistence of the udumbara flower cannot be imputed.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las kyang yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las kyang yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Thus, because the TathƒÅgata does not exist due to his own nature and he does not exist due to the nature of another, therefore it is said:

original: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
translated: How could the four such as permanence

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: and impermanence exist in this peace?

original: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
translated: How could the four such as having an end

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: and not having an end exist in this peace?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid stong pa ngo bo nyid zhi ba gang yin pa de la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi po /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid stong pa ngo bo nyid zhi ba gang yin pa de la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi po /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is empty of essential nature, and his essential nature is peace. How could the four such as permanence and impermanence exist in this peace?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag kyang rtag la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag kyang rtag la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata is impermanent,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata is both permanent and impermanent,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata is neither permanent nor impermanent‚Äù?

original: mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag 'thad @265b par ga la 'gyur /üîΩmtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhi po /
analyzed: mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag 'thad @265b par ga la 'gyur / mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhi po /
translated: How could it be tenable to say, ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata has an end,‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yod kyang yod la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yod kyang yod la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata does not have an end,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata has an end and also does not have an end,‚Äù

original: mtha' med kyang med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag 'thad par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtha' med kyang med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag 'thad par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata does not have an end and also does not not have an end‚Äù?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang bral ba gang yin pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig tu 'gyur ba de gang yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang bral ba gang yin pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig tu 'gyur ba de gang yin /
translated: The so-called TathƒÅgata is devoid of intrinsic reality and other things, and it is not any of those such as permanent, impermanent, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa med do zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa med do zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Because he is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, one should not say, ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata does not exist.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gang brten nas gdags par bya ba de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang brten nas gdags par bya ba de /
translated: Because whatever is imputed in dependence

original: ji ltar med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar med par 'gyur /
translated: how could that be nonexistent?

original: 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang /
translated: And later it says:

original: de ltar len las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar len las gzhan ma yin //
translated: Thus it is not different from appropriation.

original: de ni nyer len nyid kyang min //
analyzed: de ni nyer len nyid kyang min //
translated: It is also not the appropriated itself.

original: bdag ni nye bar len med min //üîΩmed pa nyid du 'ang de ma nges //
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len med min // med pa nyid du 'ang de ma nges //
translated: The self does not exist without appropriation.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is also not ascertained as nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid kyi phyogs dang bral ba tshe 'di nyid la brten pa las de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med pa la gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa'i sems dang ldan pa de kho na mthong
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid kyi phyogs dang bral ba tshe 'di nyid la brten pa las de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med pa la gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa'i sems dang ldan pa de kho na mthong
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata is free from the positions of existence and nonexistence. The TathƒÅgata is not perceived in this very life. Those who are confused and have minds that are completely bound by delusion,

original: ba lkog tu gyur pa /
analyzed: ba lkog tu gyur pa /
translated: who are obscured with respect to seeing reality,

original: gang gis 'dzin sdug gzung gyur ba //üîΩde ni mya ngan 'das pa la //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa yod ce 'am //üîΩmed ces rnam rtog rtog par byed //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin sdug gzung gyur ba // de ni mya ngan 'das pa la // de bzhin gshegs pa yod ce 'am // med ces rnam rtog rtog par byed //
translated: who are bound by thick bonds,üîΩthink, ‚ÄúThis is true, the other is meaningless.‚ÄùüîΩThey think, ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata exists after attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äù

original: gang gis 'dzin pa stug po gzung bar 'gyur ba 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o snyam du sems pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la 'di lta ste /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa yod pa nyid do zhe'am /
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin pa stug po gzung bar 'gyur ba 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o snyam du sems pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la 'di lta ste / de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa nyid do zhe'am /
translated: or ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata does not exist after attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa med pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa la de ltar rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa med pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa la de ltar rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: They think in this way about the TathƒÅgata who has attained nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod ce 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod ce 'am /
translated: The Tathagata exists after attaining nirvana?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med ce'am//üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod kyang yod la med kyang med ce'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med ce'am// de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod kyang yod la med kyang med ce'am /
translated: The Tathagata does not exist after attaining nirvana?üîΩ The Tathagata both exists and does not exist after attaining nirvana?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de lta rtog par byed do //üîΩgang dag bdag nyid che brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i sgron me'i snang @266a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de lta rtog par byed do // gang dag bdag nyid che brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i sgron me'i snang @266a * //
translated: The Tathagata neither exists nor does not exist after attaining nirvana?

original: bas blo'i mig la phan btags pa dang / dngos po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: bas blo'i mig la phan btags pa dang / dngos po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those who are supported by the greatness of the self, who are helped by the eye of the mind with the light of the lamp of the knowledge of dependent origination, and who see things as they areüîΩdo not think

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong de la //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong de la //
translated: that which is empty of essence

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan 'das nas ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan 'das nas ni //
translated: The Buddha, after attaining nirvana,

original: yod do zhe'am med do zhes //üîΩbsam pa 'thad pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yod do zhe'am med do zhes //üîΩbsam pa 'thad pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: exists or does not exist,üîΩor both exists and does not exist,üîΩor neither exists nor does not exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos pos stong pa sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa lta bu mya ngan las 'das pa de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas yod do zhe 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos pos stong pa sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa lta bu mya ngan las 'das pa de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas yod do zhe 'am /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is empty of intrinsic reality and of extrinsic reality, like an illusion, a reflection, or an emanation.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas med do zhes bsam pa de dag 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas med do zhes bsam pa de dag 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The thought that the BhagavƒÅn Buddha exists after attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa or that he does not exist after attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa is not tenable.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' bo khyod 'di ltar tshe 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba de bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' bo khyod 'di ltar tshe 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba de bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod do zhe'am /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúNanda, it is not tenable to say that you do not see the TathƒÅgata in this life.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med do zhes pa dag gis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med do zhes pa dag gis /
translated: The thought that the TathƒÅgata exists after attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa or that the TathƒÅgata does not exist after attaining nirvƒÅ·πáaüîΩis not tenable.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas spros 'das shing //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas spros 'das shing //
translated: Those who superimpose the Buddha,

original: zad pa med la spros byed pa //
analyzed: zad pa med la spros byed pa //
translated: who is beyond conceptual elaboration,üîΩwith existence or nonexistence after attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: spros pas nyams pa de kun gyis //
analyzed: spros pas nyams pa de kun gyis //
translated: All those who are ruined by conceptual elaboration

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: do not see the TathƒÅgata.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gang dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i spros pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing zad pa med pa la /üîΩyod pa dang med pa dang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i spros pa rnams kyis spros par byed pa de dag thams cad ni spros pa de dag gis ye shes kyi mig nyams pas dmus long gis nyi ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa mthong
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gang dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i spros pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing zad pa med pa la / yod pa dang med pa dang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i spros pa rnams kyis spros par byed pa de dag thams cad ni spros pa de dag gis ye shes kyi mig nyams pas dmus long gis nyi ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa mthong
translated: Therefore, those who elaborate the Buddha BhagavƒÅn, who is beyond all mundane elaborations and is not subject to destruction, with the elaborations of existence and nonexistence, permanence and impermanence, etc.,

original: bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: all of them, by the impairment of the eye of wisdom due to those elaborations, do not see the TathƒÅgata like the blind do not see the sun.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la gnas pa la yod pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i spros pa rnams kyis ji ltar lta bar nus /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la gnas pa la yod pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i spros pa rnams kyis ji ltar lta bar nus /
translated: How can one see the TathƒÅgata, who abides in the supramundane Dharma, with mundane elaborations such as existence, etc.?

original: zad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba med pa'i don te /
analyzed: zad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba med pa'i don te /
translated: The term not subject to destruction means the meaning of non-going.üîΩ As it is said:

original: 'gro med gom pa gang gis bkri /üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gro med gom pa gang gis bkri /üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: By what step is the non-goer led?

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas de la srid pa'i rgyun ni yod pa kho na yin te ;
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas de la srid pa'i rgyun ni yod pa kho na yin te ;
translated: Therefore, since the TathƒÅgata is essenceless, the continuum of existence definitely exists.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: So it is illogical to say that the continuum of existence exists because the TathƒÅgata exists.

original: de la 'jig rten ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here the world is twofold:

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang 'du byed kyi 'jig rten du 'dod do //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang 'du byed kyi 'jig rten du 'dod do //
translated: the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pas ni sems can gyi 'jig rten yang brtags pa yin @266b la ;
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pas ni sems can gyi 'jig rten yang brtags pa yin @266b la ;
translated: Here, by investigating the TathƒÅgata, the world of sentient beings is investigated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pa 'di nyid kyis 'du byed kyi 'jig rten yang brtags par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pa 'di nyid kyis 'du byed kyi 'jig rten yang brtags par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: By this very investigation of the TathƒÅgata, one should understand that the world of the environment is also investigated.üîΩWhy is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because:

original: 'di ltar / de bzhin gshegs pa dngos nyid gang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de bzhin gshegs pa dngos nyid gang //
translated: The essence of the TathƒÅgata

original: de ni 'gro 'di'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de ni 'gro 'di'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: Is the essence of this world.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pa 'di nyid kyis 'gro ba 'di dag kyang brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pa 'di nyid kyis 'gro ba 'di dag kyang brtags pa yin no //
translated: Because the essence of the TathƒÅgata is also the essence of this world, therefore this world is also investigated by this very investigation of the TathƒÅgata.

original: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin /
translated: Objection: What is the essence of the TathƒÅgata?üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de bzhin gshegs pa dngos nyid med //
analyzed: bshad pa / de bzhin gshegs pa dngos nyid med //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has no intrinsic reality.

original: 'gro 'di ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: 'gro 'di ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: This world has no intrinsic reality.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin gyi rang las rab tu grub pa med pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin gyi rang las rab tu grub pa med pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Because the TathƒÅgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, he is not self-established. Therefore he has no intrinsic reality.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag kyang de dang de dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin gyi 'di dag la rang las rab tu grub pa cung zad kyang med pas de'i phyir 'gro ba yang de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag kyang de dang de dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin gyi 'di dag la rang las rab tu grub pa cung zad kyang med pas de'i phyir 'gro ba yang de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: These reincarnating beings are also to be imputed in dependence on those and those, but they do not exist in the least by way of their own nature. Therefore, just like the TathƒÅgata, reincarnating beings also lack entityness.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir 'di la yang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir 'di la yang /
translated: Because they lack entityness,

original: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
translated: the four such as permanent and impermanent

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: do not exist in the least in this peace.

original: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
translated: The four such as finite and infinite

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: do not exist in the least in this peace.

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: smras pa / de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / de lta ma yin te /
translated: Objection: That is not so.

original: 'dus byas ni gcig tu mi rtag pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni gcig tu mi rtag pa zhes brjod la /
translated: Compounded phenomena are said to be impermanent in one sense,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtag pa zhes mi brjod pas de la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtag pa zhes mi brjod pas de la /
translated: but the TathƒÅgata is not said to be impermanent. Therefore,üîΩhow could it be tenable to say,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos nyid gang //üîΩde ni 'gro 'di'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos nyid gang // de ni 'gro 'di'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is the reality of the TathƒÅgata

original: ces bya bar ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: ces bya bar ji ltar 'thad /
translated: is the entityness of these reincarnating beings‚Äù?

original: bshad pa / de ni 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni 'og nas kyang /
translated: Response: This is also explained below:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
translated: The buddhas‚Äô teaching of the dharma

original: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
translated: And is well grounded in the two truths.üîΩ

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The two truths are the ultimate truth and the conventional truth of the world.üîΩThe conventional truth of the world is that a pot exists and a cloth exists.

original: zhes 'byung bas de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang gis bum pa yod do sab ma yod do zhes brjod pa de nyid kyis bum pa chag go sab ma tshig go zhes de dag mi rtag par yang brjod do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang gis bum pa yod do sab ma yod do zhes brjod pa de nyid kyis bum pa chag go sab ma tshig go zhes de dag mi rtag par yang brjod do //
translated: By the same conventional truth of the world, it is said that a pot is broken and a cloth is burned, and so they are impermanent.

original: gang gi tshe de kho na sab ma tsam pa de'i tshe ni bum pa dang sab ma dag brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pas mi 'thad na de dag chag pa dang tshig pa lta 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de kho na sab ma tsam pa de'i tshe ni bum pa dang sab ma dag brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pas mi 'thad na de dag chag pa dang tshig pa lta 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: When they are just like a cloth, then it is not tenable that a pot and a cloth are imputed in dependence, so how could it be tenable that they are broken and burned?

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa bgres @267a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa bgres @267a * //
translated: Moreover, by the power of the conventional truth of the world, it is said that the TathƒÅgata is old and

original: so ; / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: so ; / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: the TathƒÅgata has passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: zhes mi rtag par yang brjod do //
analyzed: zhes mi rtag par yang brjod do //
translated: By that same conventional truth of the world, it is said that the TathƒÅgata is impermanent.

original: gang gi tshe don dam par bsam pa de'i tshe ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mi 'thad na bgres pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag lta 'thad par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don dam par bsam pa de'i tshe ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mi 'thad na bgres pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag lta 'thad par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: When one considers the ultimate, then since the TathƒÅgata himself is not tenable, how could his birth and nirvƒÅ·πáa be tenable?

analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever is the essence of the TathƒÅgata is also the essence of this world.

analyzed: de lta bas na sems can gyi 'jig rten brtags pas 'du byed kyi 'jig rten yang brtags par grub po //
translated: Thus, since the world of sentient beings is imagined, the world of formations is also imagined.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa'o /

analyzed: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'brel ba bud dha p'a li ta /

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid las med //

analyzed: de phyir nyon mongs yang dag med //

translated: Those that arise from conceptualization in dependence on the error of the attractive and the unattractive do not exist due to their own intrinsic reality. Therefore, afflictions are not real.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: bdag gi yod nyid med nyid ni //
analyzed: bdag gi yod nyid med nyid ni //

analyzed: ji lta bur yang 'grub pa med //

original: de med nyon mongs rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: de med nyon mongs rnams kyi ni //

original: yod nyid med nyid ji ltar 'grub //
analyzed: yod nyid med nyid ji ltar 'grub //

analyzed: bdag gi yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid ni rnam pa gang gis kyang ji lta bur yang 'grub pa med do //

analyzed: bdag de med na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /

analyzed: de yang 'grub pa yod ma yin //

analyzed: gal te gang med ci zhig @267b yod ;

analyzed: gang med na ci zhig yod de nyon mongs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //

original: nyon mongs can la rnam lngar med //
analyzed: nyon mongs can la rnam lngar med //
translated: The afflictions do not exist in the five ways

original: rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs can //
analyzed: rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs can //

original: nyon mongs pa la rnam lngar med //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la rnam lngar med //

translated: Just as the view of one‚Äôs body does not exist in the five aggregates in the five ways, in the same way, the afflictions do not exist in the afflicted mind in the five ways.

analyzed: ji ltar rang gi lus la lta ba phung po lnga bo dag rnam pa lngar yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lngar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the view of one‚Äôs body does not exist in the five aggregates in the five ways, in the same way, the afflicted mind does not exist in the afflictions in the five ways.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / ngo bo nyid las yod min pa //
analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / ngo bo nyid las yod min pa //
translated: The pleasant, the unpleasant, and error Do not exist through their intrinsic reality.

analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten nas nyon mongs gang dag yin // sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: The afflictions that arise in dependence on The pleasant, the unpleasant, and errorüîΩThe pleasant, the unpleasant, and error do not exist through their intrinsic reality.

analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gang yang dag pa ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not real does not exist.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log de dag yod pa ma yin na de dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log de dag yod pa ma yin na de dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag ma yin te /

analyzed: de dag gi rgyu can nyon mongs pa rnams ji ltar yod par 'gyur /

analyzed: smras pa / gzugs sgra ro dang reg bya dang // dri dang chos dag rnam drug ni //
translated: Objection: The six sense objects, Form, sound, taste, tactility, Smell, and phenomena,

analyzed: gzhi ste 'dod chags zhe sdang dang // gti mug gi ni yin par brtags //

translated: Form, sound, taste, tactility, smell, and mental objects are the six types of objects that are conceptualized as the bases of attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: gzhi de dag yod na sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag kun tu 'byung bas de'i phyir sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag la brten nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhi de dag yod na sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag kun tu 'byung bas de'i phyir sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag la brten nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: If those bases exist, then the errors of attraction and repulsion occur. Therefore, attachment, aversion, and delusion arise in dependence on the errors of attraction and repulsion.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:üîΩAttractive and repulsiveüîΩforms, sounds, tastes, tactile objects,

original: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang // dri dang chos dag 'ga' zhig pa //
analyzed: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang // dri dang chos dag 'ga' zhig pa //
translated: smells, and mental objectsüîΩare like a city of gandharvas,

analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang // smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
translated: like a mirage, like a dream.üîΩLike an illusory person,

analyzed: @268a * // sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu dang // gzugs brnyan 'dra ba de dag la // sdug pa dang ni mi sdug pa //
translated: like a reflection,üîΩhow could attraction and repulsion

analyzed: 'byung bar yang ni ga la 'gyur //
translated: arise with respect to them?

analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / dri dang / chos dag ni 'ba' zhig pa bral ba ci yang med pa ma 'dres ba ngo bo nyid med pa ste ;
translated: Form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and mental objects are solitary, devoid of anything, unmixed, and essenceless.

original: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang smig rgyu dang rmi lam 'dra ba yin pas /
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang smig rgyu dang rmi lam 'dra ba yin pas /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu dang gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba de dag la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /

analyzed: yang gzhan yang / gang la brten nas sdug pa zhes //
translated: Moreover,üîΩAttractive things are imputed

original: mi sdug par ni gdags bya ba //
analyzed: mi sdug par ni gdags bya ba //

analyzed: sdug pa mi ltos yod min pas //

original: de phyir sdug pa 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir sdug pa 'thad ma yin //

original: gang la brten nas mi sdug pa mi sdug par gdags par bya'i sdug pa mi sdug pa la ma ltos pa'i snga rol na yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad pa ma yin no //üîΩgang la brten nas mi sdug pa //

translated: Attractive things are imputed in dependence on unattractive things. Attractive things do not exist prior to unattractive things. Therefore attractive things are not tenable.üîΩAttractive things are imputed

original: sdug pa zhes ni gdags bya ba //
analyzed: sdug pa zhes ni gdags bya ba //
translated: In dependence on unattractive things.

original: mi sdug mi ltos yod min pas //
analyzed: mi sdug mi ltos yod min pas //
translated: Since the unpleasant does not exist without depending on the pleasant,

original: de phyir mi sdug 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir mi sdug 'thad ma yin //
translated: Therefore the unpleasant is not tenable.

original: gang la brten nas sdug pa sdug par gdags par bya'i mi sdug pa sdug pa la ma ltos pa'i snga rol na yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mi sdug pa 'thad pa ma yin no //

original: sdug pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: sdug pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the pleasant does not exist,

original: 'dod chags 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could attachment arise?

original: mi sdug yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mi sdug yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the unpleasant does not exist,

analyzed: zhe sdang 'byung bar ga la 'gyur // sdug pa yod pa ma yin na 'dod chags 'byung bar ga la 'gyur zhing /
translated: How could aversion arise?üîΩIf the pleasant does not exist, how could attachment arise?

original: mi sdug pa yod pa ma yin na zhe sdang 'byung bar ga la yang 'gyur /
analyzed: mi sdug pa yod pa ma yin na zhe sdang 'byung bar ga la yang 'gyur /

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: mdo sde las rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log bzhi yod par gsungs pas de dag yod pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu 'gyur pa yang yod do //
translated: Since the four errors such as permanence are said to exist in the s≈´tras, error exists because they exist.

analyzed: de la gang mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes 'dzin pa de ni phyin ci log yin la /
translated: In this regard, the apprehension of the impermanent as permanent is an error.

original: gang mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya bar 'dzin pa de ni phyin ci log ma yin te /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya bar 'dzin pa de ni phyin ci log ma yin te /

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same goes for the remaining views.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te mi rtag rtag pa zhes //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag rtag pa zhes //
translated: If apprehending the impermanent as permanent

original: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //
translated: Is a misconception,

original: stong la rtag pa yod min pas //
analyzed: stong la rtag pa yod min pas //
translated: Since the permanent does not exist in the empty,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
translated: How could apprehending it not be a misconception?

original: gal te mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes de ltar 'dzin pa phyin ci log ma yin no snyam du sems na de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes de ltar 'dzin pa phyin ci log ma yin no snyam du sems na de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: If you think that apprehending the impermanent as permanent is not a misconception, then we would reply:

original: ngo bo nyid stong @268b pa la mi rtag pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas de med na de ltar 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong @268b pa la mi rtag pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas de med na de ltar 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Since the impermanent is empty of essence, the permanent does not exist in the slightest. Since it does not exist, how could apprehending it not be a misconception?

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //üîΩgal te mi rtag mi rtag ces //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no // gal te mi rtag mi rtag ces //
translated: The same goes for the remaining views.üîΩIf apprehending the impermanent as impermanent

original: de ltar 'dzin pa log min pa //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa log min pa //
translated: Is not a misconception,

original: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
analyzed: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
translated: Since the impermanent does not exist in the empty,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin ;
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin ;
translated: How could apprehending it not be a misconception?

original: / gal te mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes de ltar 'dzin pa phyin ci log ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: / gal te mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes de ltar 'dzin pa phyin ci log ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that to apprehend the impermanent as impermanent is not an error,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa la mi rtag pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas de med na de ltar 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa la mi rtag pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas de med na de ltar 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Since nothing whatsoever that is impermanent exists in the emptiness of intrinsic reality, how could the apprehension of that which does not exist be nonerroneous?

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same goes for the remaining [aggregates].üîΩThe apprehender, that which is apprehended,

original: gang gis 'dzin dang 'dzin gang dang // 'dzin pa po dang gang gzung ba //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin dang 'dzin gang dang // 'dzin pa po dang gang gzung ba //
translated: The agent of apprehension, and that which is apprehended

original: thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste //
analyzed: thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste //
translated: All are completely pacified.

original: de phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, apprehension does not exist.

original: gang gis 'dzin pa ni byed par gyur pas so //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin pa ni byed par gyur pas so //
translated: The apprehender is the one who acts.

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa ni dngos por gyur pa'o //üîΩ'dzin pa po gang yin pa ni byed pa por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa ni dngos por gyur pa'o // 'dzin pa po gang yin pa ni byed pa por gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is apprehended is the object.üîΩThe agent of apprehension is the one who acts.

original: gang gzung ba ni las su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzung ba ni las su gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is apprehended is the object.

original: de dag thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni ngo bo nyid las nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni ngo bo nyid las nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: All of these are completely pacified, pacified in terms of their intrinsic reality.

original: de dag ji lta ba de ltar song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa brtag pa rgyas par bshad zin pas /
analyzed: de dag ji lta ba de ltar song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa brtag pa rgyas par bshad zin pas /
translated: Because we have already extensively explained the analysis of where one has gone, where one has not gone, and where one goes,

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //üîΩlog pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no // log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //
translated: therefore grasping does not exist.

original: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //üîΩgang la phyin ci log yod cing //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na // gang la phyin ci log yod cing //
translated: If grasping does not existüîΩIn reality or falsely,üîΩWith respect to what would error exist?

original: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
translated: With respect to what would non-error exist?

original: log pa'am yang dag pa nyid du 'dzin pa de dag yod pa ma yin na gang la phyin ci log yod par 'gyur zhing gang la phyin ci ma log pa yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: log pa'am yang dag pa nyid du 'dzin pa de dag yod pa ma yin na gang la phyin ci log yod par 'gyur zhing gang la phyin ci ma log pa yod par 'gyur /

original: yang gzhan yang //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang //
translated: Moreover:üîΩError does not exist

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa la //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa la //
translated: With respect to that which is in error.

original: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: Error does not exist

original: phyin ci log tu ma gyur la'ang //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu ma gyur la'ang //
translated: With respect to that which is not in error.

original: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: Error does not exist

original: phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin la'ang //üîΩphyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin la'ang // phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: With respect to that which is in the process of becoming in error.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa la phyin ci log dag mi srid cing /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa la phyin ci log dag mi srid cing /
translated: Error does not exist with respect to that which is in error.

original: phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa la yang mi srid /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa la yang mi srid /

original: phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin pa la yang mi srid de /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin pa la yang mi srid de /

analyzed: ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar ni song ba dang / ma song ba dang bgom pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed bar rgyas par bstan pa bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o // gang la phyin ci log srid pa //
translated: Just how it is impossible should be understood in accordance with the detailed explanation in the Topic Divisions.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni rnam par @269a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni rnam par @269a * //
translated: You should analyze for yourselfüîΩwhether or not error is possible.

analyzed: dpyod / de gang la phyin ci log dag srid pa bdag nyid kyis rnam par dpyod cig / yang gzhan yang /

analyzed: phyin ci log rnams ma skyes na //
translated: If error has not arisen,

original: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
translated: how could it exist?

original: phyin ci log rnams skye med na //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams skye med na //

analyzed: phyin ci log can ga la yod //

analyzed: phyin ci log gang dag ngo bo nyid las ma skyes pa de dag ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur /

analyzed: de phyin ci log de rnams ngo bo nyid las skye ba med na phyin ci log can yod par ga la 'gyur /

analyzed: dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //

analyzed: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //

original: bdag dang gzhan las kyang min na //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las kyang min na //

original: phyin ci log can ga la yod //
analyzed: phyin ci log can ga la yod //
translated: How could one who has errors exist?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dag / rtag dang bde ba yod na ni //
analyzed: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dag / rtag dang bde ba yod na ni //
translated: If the self, the attractive, permanence, and happiness exist,

analyzed: bdag shes sdug shes rtag shes dang // bde shes phyin ci log ma yin //

analyzed: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang rtag pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba bzhi po de dag yod na ni de dag yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rtag tu shes pa dang / sdug par shes pa dang / rtag par shes pa dang / bde bar shes pa de dag phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la 'di snyam du bdag dang sdug pa dang rtag pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba bzhi po de dag ni yod pa ma yin gyi bdag med pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag ni yod do /
translated: But if you think that the four, the self, the attractive, the permanent, and the blissful do not exist, but the four, selflessness, the unattractive, impermanence, and suffering do exist,

analyzed: de dag la phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas phyin ci log dag kyang yod par sems na /
translated: and that the errors exist because they apprehend those as erroneous,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩIf the self, the attractive,
