analyzed: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba med na ni //
translated: The permanent, and the blissful do not exist,üîΩSelflessness, the unattractive, impermanence,

analyzed: bdag med mi sdug mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang rtag pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba bzhi po de dag med na ni /

analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir bdag med pa dang mi sdug pa dang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba bzhi po dag kyang yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i khyad par 'dis kyang phyin ci log rnams yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'du byed la sogs 'gag par 'gyur //

original: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //

analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid yod na //

analyzed: ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //

analyzed: yod pa su zhig spong bar byed //

analyzed: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa gang dag ngo bo nyid kyis yod cing yang dag pa dang de kho na dang bden pa yin na de dag ji ltar spang bar 'gyur /

analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //

analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid med na //

analyzed: ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //

analyzed: med pa su zhig spong bar byed //

analyzed: kun la gnod pa byed pa yin //
translated: and all mundane conventions.

original: stong pa nyid bzung na chos ma yin pa dang chos nyid dang de dag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kun la yang gnod pa byed pa yin pas de lta bas na dngos po thams cad stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bzung na chos ma yin pa dang chos nyid dang de dag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kun la yang gnod pa byed pa yin pas de lta bas na dngos po thams cad stong pa ma yin no //
translated: If you grasp emptiness, you undermine the existence of the non-Dharmic, the Dharmic, and their effects, and all mundane conventions. Therefore, all things are not empty.

original: de la bshad pa khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: de la bshad pa khyod kyis ni //
translated: Here we reply: You

original: stong nyid dgos dang stong nyid dang // stong nyid don ni ma rtogs pas //
analyzed: stong nyid dgos dang stong nyid dang // stong nyid don ni ma rtogs pas //
translated: Because they do not understand the purpose of emptiness, the characteristics of emptiness, and the meaning of emptiness,

original: de phyir de ltar gnod pa byed //
analyzed: de phyir de ltar gnod pa byed //
translated: they thus do harm.

original: khyod kyis ni stong pa nyid bstan pa'i dgos pa gang yin pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang stong pa nyid kyi don gang yin pa de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa de'i phyir de ltar gnod pa byed do //
analyzed: khyod kyis ni stong pa nyid bstan pa'i dgos pa gang yin pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang stong pa nyid kyi don gang yin pa de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa de'i phyir de ltar gnod pa byed do //
translated: You do not understand correctly the purpose of teaching emptiness, the characteristics of emptiness, and the meaning of emptiness. Therefore, you do harm.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by the Buddhas

original: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //üîΩ'jig rten kun rdzob ba bden dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten // 'jig rten kun rdzob ba bden dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
translated: is based on the two truths.üîΩThere is the conventional truth of the world,

original: gang dag bden pa de gnyis kyi //
analyzed: gang dag bden pa de gnyis kyi //
translated: and there is the truth of ultimate reality.

original: rnam dbye rnam par mi shes pa //
analyzed: rnam dbye rnam par mi shes pa //
translated: Those who do not know the distinction

original: de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa ni //
translated: between these two truths

original: zab mo'i de nyid rnam mi shes //
analyzed: zab mo'i de nyid rnam mi shes //
translated: do not know the profound realityüîΩtaught by the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni bden pa gnyis po 'di dag la brten nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni bden pa gnyis po 'di dag la brten nas 'byung ste /
translated: The teachings of the Bhagavan Buddhas occur on the basis of these two truths.

original: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba @270b ni chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa dag la 'jig rten gyis phyin ci log ma rtogs pas chos thams cad skye bar mthong ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba @270b ni chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa dag la 'jig rten gyis phyin ci log ma rtogs pas chos thams cad skye bar mthong ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The so-called conventional truth of the world is the perception of the production of all phenomena by the world, which does not understand that things are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de ni de dag nyid la kun rdzob tu bden pa nyid yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de dag nyid la kun rdzob tu bden pa nyid yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Since that is the truth in the conventional sense for them, it is the conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyis phyin ci log tu thugs su chud pas chos thams cad skye ba med par gzigs pa gang yin pa ste de ni de dag nyid la don dam par bden pa nyid yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyis phyin ci log tu thugs su chud pas chos thams cad skye ba med par gzigs pa gang yin pa ste de ni de dag nyid la don dam par bden pa nyid yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is the perception of the non-production of all phenomena by the noble ones, who understand things as they are. Since that is the truth in the ultimate sense for them, it is the ultimate truth.

original: de la gang dag kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa de gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba rnam par mi shes pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa zab mo'i de nyid rnam par mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gang dag kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa de gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba rnam par mi shes pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa zab mo'i de nyid rnam par mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not know the division of the two truths, the conventional truth and the ultimate truth, do not know the profound reality of the Buddha‚Äôs teaching.

original: 'di la 'di snyam du smra bar 'dod pa'i don ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i bden pa de nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di la 'di snyam du smra bar 'dod pa'i don ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i bden pa de nyid yin na /
translated: In this regard, if you think that the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúAll phenomena are not produced‚Äù is the ultimate truth,

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa gnyis pa 'di ci dgos snyam du sems na /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa gnyis pa 'di ci dgos snyam du sems na /
translated: why is a second truth, the conventional truth, necessary?

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
analyzed: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
translated: Without relying on the conventional,

original: dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus //
translated: The ultimate cannot be taught.

original: dam pa'i don la ma brten par //
analyzed: dam pa'i don la ma brten par //
translated: Without relying on the ultimate,

original: mya ngan 'das pa thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa thob mi 'gyur //
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa cannot be attained.

original: gang gi phyir tha snyad la ma brten par don dam pa bstan par mi nus pa dang / gang gi phyir don dam pa la ma brten par mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir bden pa gnyis ka gdags dgos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha snyad la ma brten par don dam pa bstan par mi nus pa dang / gang gi phyir don dam pa la ma brten par mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir bden pa gnyis ka gdags dgos so //
translated: Because the ultimate cannot be taught without relying on the conventional, and because nirvana cannot be attained without relying on the ultimate, therefore both truths must be designated.

original: stong pa nyid la lta nyes na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la lta nyes na //
translated: If emptiness is viewed incorrectly,

original: shes rab chung rnams phung bar byed //
analyzed: shes rab chung rnams phung bar byed //
translated: those of little wisdom are ruined.üîΩLike a snake wrongly grasped,

original: ji ltar sbrul la bzung nyes dang // rig sngags nyes par bsgrub pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar sbrul la bzung nyes dang // rig sngags nyes par bsgrub pa bzhin //
translated: or a knowledge-mantra wrongly accomplished.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid la lta nyes na shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pa phung bar byed cing de la gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la lta nyes na shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pa phung bar byed cing de la gnod pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur te //
translated: If emptiness is viewed incorrectly, those who have little wisdom are ruined, and great harm will come to them.

original: ji ltar dper na sbrul la bzung nyes na phung bar byed cing de la 'chi ba la thug pa'i nyen chen po skyed par byed pa dang / ji ltar dper na rig sngags dang gsang sngags bya ba dang cho ga nyams pas bsgrubs nyes na phung bar byed cing de la srog gi mthar thug pa'i nyen chen po skyed par byed pa de bzhin no //üîΩde phyir zhan pas chos 'di yi //
analyzed: ji ltar dper na sbrul la bzung nyes na phung bar byed cing de la 'chi ba la thug pa'i nyen chen po skyed par byed pa dang / ji ltar dper na rig sngags dang gsang sngags bya ba dang cho ga nyams pas bsgrubs nyes na phung bar byed cing de la srog gi mthar thug pa'i nyen chen po skyed par byed pa de bzhin no // de phyir zhan pas chos 'di yi //
translated: Just as, for example, if you wrongly grasp a snake, it will destroy you and cause you to incur the great danger of death, and just as, for example, if you wrongly practice a spell, incantation, or ritual, it will destroy you and cause you to incur the great danger of death.üîΩTherefore, knowing that it is difficult

original: gting rtogs dka' bar mkhyen gyur nas //üîΩthub pa'i thugs ni chos bstan las //
analyzed: gting rtogs dka' bar mkhyen gyur nas // thub pa'i thugs ni chos bstan las //
translated: for the weak to fathom this teaching,üîΩthe mind of the Subduer turned away

original: rab tu log par gyur pa yin //üîΩrgyu de kho na'i phyir shes rab zhan pa rnams kyis chos 'di'i @271a * //
analyzed: rab tu log par gyur pa yin // rgyu de kho na'i phyir shes rab zhan pa rnams kyis chos 'di'i @271a * //
translated: from teaching the Dharma.

original: gting rtogs par dka' ba nyid du mkhyen par gyu nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs chos bstan pa las rab tu log par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gting rtogs par dka' ba nyid du mkhyen par gyu nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs chos bstan pa las rab tu log par gyur pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, knowing that it is difficult for those of weak intelligence to fathom the depths of this teaching, the mind of the Subduer turned away from teaching the Dharma.üîΩYou have turned your mind away from teaching the Dharma

original: khyod ni nga la stong pa nyid //
analyzed: khyod ni nga la stong pa nyid //
translated: because you think that it is difficult for those of weak intelligence to understand emptiness.

original: skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba yis //
analyzed: skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba yis //
translated: Because of the fault of the consequence,

original: spong bar byed pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is to be abandoned,

original: de ni stong la mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni stong la mi 'thad do //
translated: That is not tenable in emptiness.

original: khyod nga la stong pa nyid skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa la mi 'thad do //
analyzed: khyod nga la stong pa nyid skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa la mi 'thad do //
translated: Whatever is to be abandoned by you, because of the fault of the consequence of emptiness for me, that is not tenable in the emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gang la stong pa nyid rung ba //
analyzed: gang la stong pa nyid rung ba //
translated: For whom emptiness makes sense,

original: de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur //
translated: Everything makes sense for them.

original: gang la stong nyid mi rung ba //
analyzed: gang la stong nyid mi rung ba //
translated: For whom emptiness does not make sense,

original: de la thams cad rung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de la thams cad rung mi 'gyur //
translated: Everything does not make sense for them.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rung ba de la 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rung ba de la 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For whom the emptiness of intrinsic reality makes sense, everything mundane and supramundane makes sense for them.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid mi rung ba de la 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad mi rung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩkhyod nyid rang gi skyon rnams ni //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid mi rung ba de la 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad mi rung bar 'gyur ro // khyod nyid rang gi skyon rnams ni //
translated: For whom the emptiness of intrinsic reality does not make sense, everything mundane and supramundane does not make sense for them.üîΩYou yourself

original: nga la yongs su sgyur byed pa //
analyzed: nga la yongs su sgyur byed pa //
translated: Are completely transforming your own faults onto me.

original: rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du //üîΩrta nyid brjod par gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du // rta nyid brjod par gyur pa bzhin //
translated: It is like someone mounted on a horseüîΩWho has forgotten that very horse.

original: khyod nyid rang gi skyon rnams nga la yongs su sgyur bar byed pa ni rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du rta de nyid brjed par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: khyod nyid rang gi skyon rnams nga la yongs su sgyur bar byed pa ni rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du rta de nyid brjed par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: You are attributing your own faults to me, like someone mounted on a horse who has forgotten that very horse.

original: yang gzhan yang /üîΩgal te dngos rnams dngos nyid las //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / gal te dngos rnams dngos nyid las //
translated: Moreover,üîΩIf you view things as existing

original: yod par rjes su lta byed na //üîΩde lta yin na dngos po rnams //
analyzed: yod par rjes su lta byed na // de lta yin na dngos po rnams //
translated: From their own intrinsic reality,üîΩThen in that case you view things

original: rgyu rkyen med par khyod lta'o //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen med par khyod lta'o //
translated: As devoid of causes and conditions.üîΩYou would be harming the effect and the cause,

original: 'bras bu dang ni rgyu nyid dang // byed pa po dang byed dang bya //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ni rgyu nyid dang // byed pa po dang byed dang bya //
translated: The agent, instrument, and action,üîΩArising and cessation,

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // 'bras bu la yang gnod pa byed //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // 'bras bu la yang gnod pa byed //
translated: And also the effect.

original: gal te dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid la yod par rjes su lta bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid la yod par rjes su lta bar byed na /
translated: If you view things as existing from their own intrinsic reality,

original: de lta na khyod dngos po rnams rgyu dang rkyen med par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na khyod dngos po rnams rgyu dang rkyen med par lta ba yin no //
translated: then in that case you view things as devoid of causes and conditions.

original: des na 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid dang byed pa po dang byed pa dang bya ba dang skye ba dang 'gag pa dang 'bras bu la yang gnod pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid dang byed pa po dang byed pa dang bya ba dang skye ba dang 'gag pa dang 'bras bu la yang gnod pa byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it undermines the effects and causes, the agent, the instrument, the action, arising and ceasing, and the effect.

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: That is explained to be emptiness.

original: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
analyzed: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
translated: That is dependent imputation.

original: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //üîΩgang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no // gang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
translated: Just that is the middle way.üîΩBecause there is no phenomenon

original: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin pa //üîΩde phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin pa // de phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
translated: That is not dependently arisen,

original: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no phenomenonüîΩThat is not empty.

original: kho bo ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid du 'chad de /
analyzed: kho bo ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid du 'chad de /
translated: We explain that whatever is dependently arisen is emptiness.

original: de ni brten nas gdags pa yin te //
analyzed: de ni brten nas gdags pa yin te //
translated: That is dependent imputation.

original: @271b de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //
analyzed: @271b de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //
translated: Just that is the middle way.

original: de la dngos po 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de la dngos po 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If some thing existed,

original: de ni brten nas 'byung ba dang brten nas gdags pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ni brten nas 'byung ba dang brten nas gdags pa yin pas /
translated: it would be dependently arisen and dependently imputed.

original: gang gi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i chos 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i chos 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because no phenomenon whatsoever is not dependently arisen, therefore no phenomenon whatsoever is not empty.

original: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
translated: If all these were not empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //üîΩ'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med // 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams //
translated: there would be neither origination nor cessation.üîΩFor you, it would follow that

original: khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the four noble truths would not exist.

original: gal te 'gro ba 'di kun mi stong na de'i phyir 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba 'di kun mi stong na de'i phyir 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: If all these beings were not empty, then there would be neither origination nor cessation.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, for you, it would follow that the four noble truths would not exist.

original: gal te ji lta zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te ji lta zhe na bshad pa /
translated: If you ask how, it is explained:

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung ma yin na //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung ma yin na //
translated: If something is not dependently arisen,

original: sdug bsngal yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could suffering exist?

original: mi rtag sdug bsngal gsungs pa de //
analyzed: mi rtag sdug bsngal gsungs pa de //
translated: The Buddha taught that what is impermanent is suffering,

original: ngo bo nyid las yod ma yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las yod ma yin //
translated: but that does not exist inherently.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin na sdug bsngal yod par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin na sdug bsngal yod par mi 'gyur te //
translated: If it were not dependently arisen, suffering would not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mdo sde dag las /
analyzed: mdo sde dag las /
translated: Because it is said in the s≈´tras:

original: mi rtag pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe impermanent is suffering.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pa de ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist inherently.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: ngo bo nyid las yod min na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las yod min na //
translated: If it does not exist inherently,

original: ci zhig kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ci zhig kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: What could arise?

original: de phyir stong nyid gnod byed la //üîΩkun 'byung yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyir stong nyid gnod byed la // kun 'byung yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, for those who repudiate emptiness,üîΩThe origin of suffering does not exist.

original: sdug bsngal de ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If suffering does not exist inherently,

original: ci zhig kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci zhig kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: What could arise?

original: ngo bo nyid las yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists inherently.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid la gnod pa byed pa la kun 'byung yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid la gnod pa byed pa la kun 'byung yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that is the case, for those who repudiate emptiness, the origin of suffering does not exist.

original: sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid yod la //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid yod la //
translated: If suffering existed inherently,

original: 'gog pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Its cessation would not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid ni yongs gnas phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni yongs gnas phyir //
translated: Because its essence would endure.

original: 'gog la gnod pa byed pa yin //
analyzed: 'gog la gnod pa byed pa yin //
translated: It is a denial of cessation.

original: sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa la 'gog pa yod pa ma yin te mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa la 'gog pa yod pa ma yin te mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If suffering existed inherently, cessation would not exist, because it would be indestructible.

original: des na ngo bo nyid yongs su gnas pa'i phyir 'gog pa la gnod pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ngo bo nyid yongs su gnas pa'i phyir 'gog pa la gnod pa byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since its essence would endure, it would be a denial of cessation.

original: lam ni ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: lam ni ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If the path existed inherently,

original: bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Meditation would not be tenable.

original: ci ste lam de bsgom bya na //
analyzed: ci ste lam de bsgom bya na //
translated: If you meditate on that path,

original: khyod kyi dngos nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi dngos nyid yod ma yin //
translated: It would not have its own nature.

original: lam ngo bo nyid yod par 'dzin na bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te don med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ngo bo nyid yod par 'dzin na bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te don med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If one maintained that the path existed inherently, meditation would not be tenable, because it would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa gang yin pa de la bsgom zhing sgrub pa'i thabs med pas de'i @272a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa gang yin pa de la bsgom zhing sgrub pa'i thabs med pas de'i @272a * //
translated: Thus, since there is no method of meditating on or accomplishing that which is permanent,

original: phyir lam bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir lam bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: therefore, meditation on the path would not be tenable.

original: ci ste lam bsgom par bya ba yin na ni khyod kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste lam bsgom par bya ba yin na ni khyod kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If you meditate on the path, it would not have its own nature.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gang tshe sdug bsngal kun 'byung dang // 'gog pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang tshe sdug bsngal kun 'byung dang // 'gog pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: And cessation do not exist,üîΩThen what is the path?

original: lam gyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni //
analyzed: lam gyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni //
translated: What is the cessation of suffering?

original: gang zhig thob par 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: gang zhig thob par 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: What is to be attained by the path?üîΩIf the three phenomena of suffering, origin, and cessation do not exist, then what is the cessation of suffering?

original: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa'i chos gsum po dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe khyod kyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa gang zhig lam gyis 'thob par 'gyur bar 'dod /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa'i chos gsum po dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe khyod kyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa gang zhig lam gyis 'thob par 'gyur bar 'dod /
translated: What is to be attained by the path?

original: yang gzhan yang /üîΩgal te ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / gal te ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: Moreover,üîΩIf suffering is not to be fully known

original: yongs su shes pa ma yin na //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ma yin na //
translated: By its very essence,

original: de ni ji ltar yongs shes 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar yongs shes 'gyur //
translated: How could it be fully known?

original: dngos nyid gnas shes ma yin nam //
analyzed: dngos nyid gnas shes ma yin nam //
translated: Is it not the case that it abides by its very essence?

original: gal te sdug bsngal gang ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su shes pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gang ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su shes pa ma yin na /
translated: If suffering is not to be fully known by its very essence,

original: de ji ltar yongs su shes par bya bar nus te /
analyzed: de ji ltar yongs su shes par bya bar nus te /
translated: how could it be fully known?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not to be fully known by its very essence.

original: khyod kyi ngo bo nyid kyis nges par gnas pa yin zhes ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyod kyi ngo bo nyid kyis nges par gnas pa yin zhes ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that it abides by its very essence?

original: de bzhin du ni khyod nyid kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni khyod nyid kyi //
translated: So too, for you,üîΩAbandonment, realization,

original: spang dang mngon sum bya ba dang // bsgom dang 'bras bu bzhi dag kyang //
analyzed: spang dang mngon sum bya ba dang // bsgom dang 'bras bu bzhi dag kyang //
translated: Meditation, and the four fruits

original: yongs su shes bzhin mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su shes bzhin mi rung ngo //
translated: Would not be tenable.

original: de bzhin du khyod nyid kyis kun 'byung ba spang pa dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa dang 'bras bu bzhi po dag kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa bzhin du mi rung ste /üîΩkun 'byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod nyid kyis kun 'byung ba spang pa dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa dang 'bras bu bzhi po dag kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa bzhin du mi rung ste / kun 'byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis /
translated: So too, for you, the origin of suffering would not be abandoned, cessation would not be realized, the path would not be meditated upon, and the four fruits would not be tenable, just like the thorough knowledge of suffering.

original: ma spangs pa gang yin pa de yang spang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: ma spangs pa gang yin pa de yang spang bar mi nus te /
translated: The origin of suffering that is not abandoned by nature cannot be abandoned.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not abandoned by nature.

original: 'gog pa ngo bo nyid kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa gang yin pa de yang mngon sum du bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'gog pa ngo bo nyid kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa gang yin pa de yang mngon sum du bya bar mi nus te /
translated: The cessation that is not realized by nature cannot be realized.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not realized by nature.

original: lam ngo bo nyid kyis ma bsgoms pa nyid gang yin pa de yang bsgoms par mi nus te /
analyzed: lam ngo bo nyid kyis ma bsgoms pa nyid gang yin pa de yang bsgoms par mi nus te /
translated: The path that is not meditated upon by nature cannot be meditated upon.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not cultivated by way of their own intrinsic reality.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i bya ba bzhi po dag kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i bya ba bzhi po dag kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, the four actions of comprehending, abandoning, manifesting, and cultivating the four noble truths are untenable.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: 'bras bu bzhi po rgyun tu zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dag kyang bya ba bzhi po dag med pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi po rgyun tu zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dag kyang bya ba bzhi po dag med pas mi rung ngo //
translated: The four fruits of stream-enterer, once-returner, non-returner, and arhat are also untenable because the four actions do not exist.

original: yang gzhan yang /üîΩngo bo nyid ni @272b yongs 'dzin pas //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / ngo bo nyid ni @272b yongs 'dzin pas //
translated: Moreover:üîΩBecause one would not obtain

analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis ni // thob pa min pa gang yin de //

original: ji ltar thob par nus par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar thob par nus par 'gyur //

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su 'dzin pas 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis thob pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag kyang thob par mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su 'dzin pas 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis thob pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag kyang thob par mi nus par 'gyur ro //

original: 'bras bu med na 'bras gnas med //
analyzed: 'bras bu med na 'bras gnas med //
translated: If there are no fruits, then those who abide in the fruits do not exist.

original: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //
translated: Those who enter the fruits also do not exist.

original: gal te skyes bu gang zag brgyad //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu gang zag brgyad //
translated: If the eight kinds of persons do not exist,

original: de dag med na dge 'dun med //
analyzed: de dag med na dge 'dun med //

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams med na 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa'i skyes bu gang zag brgyad po dag kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams med na 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa'i skyes bu gang zag brgyad po dag kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the fruits of the spiritual practitioner do not exist, then the eight kinds of persons who abide in the fruits and who enter the fruits do not exist.

analyzed: gal te skyes bu gang zag brgyad po de dag med na dge 'dun yang med do //
translated: If those eight kinds of persons do not exist, then the Sa·πÖgha does not exist.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: chos dang dge 'dun yod min na //
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun yod min na //

original: ma brten par yang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma brten par yang thal bar 'gyur //

analyzed: khyod kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni //

analyzed: sangs rgyas min pa gang yin des //

analyzed: byang chub byang chub spyod pa la //

analyzed: brtsal kyang byang chub 'thob mi 'gyur // 'ga' yang chos dang chos min pa //

analyzed: ngo bo nyid la bya ba med //

analyzed: chos dang chos min rgyus byung ba'i // 'bras bu gal te khyod la yod // chos dang chos min las byung ba'i //

original: 'bras bu ci phyir stong ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu ci phyir stong ma yin //

original: 'jig rten pa yin tha snyad ni //üîΩkun la'ang gnod pa byed pa yin //üîΩrten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa'i //

analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnod pa byed //

analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnod byed na //

analyzed: mi byed pa yang byed par 'gyur //

translated: would be devoid of various states, and would be unarisen and unceased, and would endure permanently.

original: de lta bas nas de ltar ngo bo nyid du smra ba yongs su 'dzin na ji skad bstan pa'i skyon de dag thams cad du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //

original: yang gzhan yang ;
analyzed: yang gzhan yang ;
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te stong pa yod min na //
analyzed: gal te stong pa yod min na //

original: nyon mongs thams cad spong ba'ang med //
analyzed: nyon mongs thams cad spong ba'ang med //

original: gal te ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid ma yin na /

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i khyad par ma thob pa thob par bya ba gang dag ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad thob par bya ba yang med par 'gyur la /

analyzed: sdug bsngal mthar byed pa'i las kyang med par 'gyur zhing /

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'ang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'ang med par 'gyur ro //

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
translated: Whoever sees dependent originationüîΩsees suffering, origin,

original: mthong ba des ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung dang ni 'gog pa dang // lam nyid de dag mthong ba yin //
analyzed: mthong ba des ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung dang ni 'gog pa dang // lam nyid de dag mthong ba yin //

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos bzhi po sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang / lam nyid ces bya ba de dag mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos bzhi po sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang / lam nyid ces bya ba de dag mthong ba yin no //
translated: Whoever sees dependent origination sees these four dharmas: suffering, origin, cessation, and the path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-fourth chapter, on the Critique of the Four Noble Truths.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
translated: If all these are empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: There would be neither origination nor cessation.

original: gang zhig spong dang 'gag pa las //
analyzed: gang zhig spong dang 'gag pa las //
translated: From the cessation and abandonment of what

analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //

analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir gang zhig spong ba dang 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar 'dod de /

analyzed: spong ba dang 'gag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta ma yin no //

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
translated: If all these are not empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: There would be neither origination nor cessation.

original: gang zhig spong dang 'gag pa las //
analyzed: gang zhig spong dang 'gag pa las //
translated: From the cessation and abandonment of what

original: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: Do you think nirvana is attained?

original: gal te 'gro ba 'di dag kun mi stong na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba 'di dag kun mi stong na /
translated: If all these reincarnating beings are not empty,

original: de lta na 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: de lta na 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med do //

analyzed: de dag med @273b pa'i phyir gang zhig spong ba dang 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod de /

analyzed: spong ba dang 'gag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: de ni mya ngan 'das par 'dod //

analyzed: yang gzhan yang /

original: mya ngan 'das pa dngos po min //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa dngos po min //

analyzed: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur //

analyzed: rga shi 'chi ba med pa yi //

analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam pa thams cad du yang dngos po ma yin no //

original: gal te dngos po yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po yin par gyur na /

analyzed: rga shi'i mtshan nyid can yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rga shi med pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //

analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus byas 'gyur //

analyzed: dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //

analyzed: 'ga' yang ji ltar yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist in any way.

analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin na de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus byas su 'gyur te /
translated: If nirvana were a thing, then nirvana would be a conditioned thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang ji ltar yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang ji ltar yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
translated: Moreover,üîΩIf nirvana were a thing,

analyzed: ji ltar myang 'das de brten min //

original: dngos po brten pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po brten pa ma yin pa //

original: 'ga' yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang yod pa yin no //

analyzed: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po med pa yin no //

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos min //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: yang gzhan yang /

analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos min //

analyzed: de ni brten min rgyur byas min //

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

original: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /

original: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //

analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa ma brten min //

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis la brtan pa'i phyir ro //

translated: But that is unacceptable. Therefore it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúNirvana is both a thing and a nonthing.‚Äù

analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'di'i phyir rigs pa ma yin te /

original: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin na //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin na //
translated: A thing and a non-thing,

analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus ma byas //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus ma byas yin la dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ni 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because nirvana is unconditioned, while a thing and a non-thing are conditioned.

analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das pa la //

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis yod par yang mi 'thad de /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
