analyzed: dngos po yang ma yin /
translated: and it is not a nonthing.

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa de dag ni med de de dag med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin zhes gang zhig gis de mngon par byed cing mtshon par byed 'dzin par byed 'dogsüîΩpar byed de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa de dag ni med de de dag med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin zhes gang zhig gis de mngon par byed cing mtshon par byed 'dzin par byed 'dogs par byed de /
translated: Since neither a thing nor a nonthing exists, who would perceive nirvana, which is neither a thing nor a nonthing? Who would perceive it, indicate it, apprehend it, or designate it as ‚Äúneither a thing nor a nonthing‚Äù?

original: de lta bas na mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúNirvana is neither a thing nor a nonthing.‚Äù

original: 'di'i phyir yang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad de /
translated: For this reason also, nirvana is untenable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bcom ldan mya ngan 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: bcom ldan mya ngan 'das gyur nas //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, having attained nirvana,üîΩIs not perceived as existent.

original: yod par mi mngon de bzhin du //
analyzed: yod par mi mngon de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way,

original: med do zhe'am gnyi ga dang // gnyis min zhes bya mi mngon no //
analyzed: med do zhe'am gnyi ga dang // gnyis min zhes bya mi mngon no //
translated: He is not perceived as nonexistent, both, or neither.

original: bcom ldan bzhugs par gyur na yang //
analyzed: bcom ldan bzhugs par gyur na yang //
translated: Even if the BhagavƒÅn were to remain,

original: yod pa mi mngon de bzhin du //
analyzed: yod pa mi mngon de bzhin du //
translated: existence would not be evident.üîΩIn the same way,

original: med do zhe'am gnyi ga dang // gnyis min zhes kyang mi mngon no //
analyzed: med do zhe'am gnyi ga dang // gnyis min zhes kyang mi mngon no //
translated: nonexistence, both, and neither are not evident.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das sam bzhugs par gyur kyang rung ste /üîΩyod do zhe'am med do zhe'am /üîΩ@275b yod kyang yod la med kyang med do zhe'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das sam bzhugs par gyur kyang rung ste / yod do zhe'am med do zhe'am / @275b yod kyang yod la med kyang med do zhe'am /
translated: Because whether the BhagavƒÅn has passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa or not,üîΩexistence is not evident.üîΩNonexistence is not evident.

original: yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Both existence and nonexistence are not evident.üîΩNeither existence nor nonexistence is not evident.

original: med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar mi mngon zhing mtshon du med gzung du med gdags su med pa de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yang gdags su med de /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar mi mngon zhing mtshon du med gzung du med gdags su med pa de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yang gdags su med de /
translated: Therefore, nirvƒÅ·πáa is not evident, cannot be indicated, cannot be grasped, and cannot be designated.

original: de med na mya ngan las 'das pa gang gi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na mya ngan las 'das pa gang gi yin par 'gyur /
translated: If it does not exist, then whose nirvƒÅ·πáa would it be?

original: de lta bas na rnam pa thams cad kyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa thams cad kyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, in every way nirvƒÅ·πáa is untenable.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das pas //
analyzed: 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das pas //
translated: Cyclic existence and nirvƒÅ·πáa

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: Do not differ in the least.

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'khor ba las //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'khor ba las //
translated: Nirvana is not different from cyclic existence.üîΩ

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: Nirvana is not in the least different from cyclic existence.

original: 'di la phung po'i rgyun la brten nas 'khor ba zhes gdags na /
analyzed: 'di la phung po'i rgyun la brten nas 'khor ba zhes gdags na /
translated: Here, if cyclic existence is designated in dependence on the continuum of the aggregates,

original: phung po de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos can yin pa de ltar kho bos dang po kho nar bstan zin pas /
analyzed: phung po de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos can yin pa de ltar kho bos dang po kho nar bstan zin pas /
translated: then, since those aggregates are empty of intrinsic reality, just as they are ultimately devoid of arising and devoid of cessation, we have explained that from the very beginning.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa mnyam pa nyid kyis 'khor ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa mnyam pa nyid kyis 'khor ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since all phenomena are the same in being devoid of arising and devoid of cessation, cyclic existence does not exist in the least as different from nirvana.

original: ji ltar 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'khor ba las khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'khor ba las khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as cyclic existence does not exist in the least as different from nirvana, so too nirvana does not exist in the least as different from cyclic existence.

original: mya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
translated: The limit of nirvana

original: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te //üîΩde gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te // de gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
translated: That is the limit of cyclic existence.üîΩThere is not the slightest difference

original: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: between the two, not even a very subtle one.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba'i yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / skye ba med pa'i mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de dag ni dmigs su med par mnyam pa nyid kyis khyad par shin tu phra ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba'i yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / skye ba med pa'i mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de dag ni dmigs su med par mnyam pa nyid kyis khyad par shin tu phra ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The limit of nirvana, the limit of the reality of cyclic existence, the limit of non-arising, and the ultimate limit of reality are the same in being non-apprehensible. They are the same in being without the slightest difference, not even a very subtle one.üîΩThe views of cessation, the limit, and so on,üîΩand of permanence and so forthüîΩare based on nirvana,

original: 'gags par gyur dang mtha' stsogs dang // rtag la sogs par lta ba dag / mya ngan 'das dang phyi mtha' dang // sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
analyzed: 'gags par gyur dang mtha' stsogs dang // rtag la sogs par lta ba dag / mya ngan 'das dang phyi mtha' dang // sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
translated: the future, and the past.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'gags par gyur nas yod pa dang med pa dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba gang dag yin pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' yod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'gags par gyur nas yod pa dang med pa dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba gang dag yin pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' yod pa dang /
translated: The views that the Tathagata exists, does not exist, both exists and does not exist, and neither exists nor does not exist after death, the views that the world is finite,

original: 'jig rten mtha' med pa dang / mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med pa dang / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang @276a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' med pa dang / mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med pa dang / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang @276a * //
translated: The views that the world is infinite, that it is both finite and infinite, that it is neither finite nor infinite,

original: ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba gang dag yin pa dang / 'jig rten rtag pa dang / 'jig rten mi rtag pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba gang dag yin pa dang / 'jig rten rtag pa dang / 'jig rten mi rtag pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la /
translated: that the world is eternal, that it is not eternal, that it is both eternal and not eternal, and that it is neither eternal nor not eternal,üîΩare, respectively, based on nirvana, the future, and the past.üîΩIn this regard:

original: mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar lta ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni go rims bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar lta ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni go rims bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no //
translated: How could there be an end or no end

original: de la / dngos po thams cad stong pa la //üîΩmtha' yod ci zhig mtha' med ci //üîΩmtha' dang mtha' med ci zhig yin //
analyzed: de la / dngos po thams cad stong pa la // mtha' yod ci zhig mtha' med ci // mtha' dang mtha' med ci zhig yin //
translated: in the emptiness of all things?üîΩHow could there be an end and no end,üîΩor neither an end nor no end?

original: mtha' min mtha' med min pa ci //üîΩde nyid ci zhig gzhan ci yin //
analyzed: mtha' min mtha' med min pa ci // de nyid ci zhig gzhan ci yin //
translated: How could there be reality or unreality,üîΩor both reality and unreality, or neither reality nor unreality?

original: rtag pa ci zhig mi rtag ci //
analyzed: rtag pa ci zhig mi rtag ci //
translated: How could there be permanence or impermanence,üîΩor both permanence and impermanence, or neither permanence nor impermanence?

original: rtag dang mi rtag gnyi ga ci //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag gnyi ga ci //
translated: How could it be both permanent and impermanent?

original: gnyi ga min pa'ang ci zhig yin //üîΩdmigs pa thams cad nyer zhi zhing //
analyzed: gnyi ga min pa'ang ci zhig yin // dmigs pa thams cad nyer zhi zhing //
translated: How could it be neither?üîΩAll objectifications are thoroughly pacified,

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ste //üîΩsangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ste // sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
translated: and elaborations are thoroughly pacified.üîΩThe Buddha has not taught

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: any dharma to anyone anywhere.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu lnga pa'o /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-fifth chapter, on Nirvana.üîΩHere someone might say, ‚ÄúYou have explained the entry into the ultimateüîΩaccording to the Mahayana scriptures. Now you should explain the entry intoüîΩthe ultimate according to the ≈õrƒÅvakas‚Äô scriptures.‚Äù

original: // /'dir smras pa /üîΩkhyod kyis theg pa chen po'i gzhung lugs kyis don dam pa la 'jug pa ni bstan zin na /üîΩda khyod kyis nyan thos kyi gzhung lugs kyi don dam pa la 'jug pa ston cig /'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa / khyod kyis theg pa chen po'i gzhung lugs kyis don dam pa la 'jug pa ni bstan zin na / da khyod kyis nyan thos kyi gzhung lugs kyi don dam pa la 'jug pa ston cig /'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ma rig bsgribs pas yang srid phyir //
analyzed: ma rig bsgribs pas yang srid phyir //
translated: Because of being obscured by ignorance,üîΩin order to be reborn,

original: 'du byed rnam pa gsum po dag / mngon par 'du byed gang yin pa'i //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa gsum po dag / mngon par 'du byed gang yin pa'i //
translated: one performs the three kinds of action.

original: las de dag gis 'gro bar 'gro //
analyzed: las de dag gis 'gro bar 'gro //
translated: By those actions one goes to the realms.

original: 'du byed rkyen can rnam par shes //
analyzed: 'du byed rkyen can rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness, conditioned by action,

original: 'gro ba rnams su 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: enters into the realms.

original: rnam par shes pa zhugs gyur na //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhugs gyur na //
translated: When consciousness has entered,

original: ming dang gzugs ni chags par 'gyur //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni chags par 'gyur //
translated: Name and form will be attached.

original: ming dang gzugs ni chags gyur na //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni chags gyur na //
translated: When name and form are attached,

original: skye mched drug ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The six sense sources will arise.

original: skye mched drug la brten nas ni //
analyzed: skye mched drug la brten nas ni //
translated: In dependence on the six sense sources,

original: de las reg pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las reg pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: From that, contact will arise.

original: ming dang gzugs dang dran byed la //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang dran byed la //
translated: In dependence on name and form and attention,

original: brten nas skye ba kho na yin //
analyzed: brten nas skye ba kho na yin //
translated: Birth will occur.

original: de ltar ming dang gzugs brten nas //
analyzed: de ltar ming dang gzugs brten nas //
translated: In this way, in dependence on name and form,

original: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur //üîΩming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur // ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness will arise.üîΩThe coming together of the three

original: gsum po 'dus pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: gsum po 'dus pa gang yin pa //
translated: Name and form and consciousness,

original: de ni reg pa reg de las //
analyzed: de ni reg pa reg de las //
translated: Is contact. From that contact,

original: tshor ba kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩtshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa ste //
analyzed: tshor ba kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur // tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa ste //
translated: Sensation will arise.üîΩSensation is the condition for craving,

original: tshor ba'i don la sred par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshor ba'i don la sred par 'gyur //
translated: Craving is for the object of sensation.

original: sred par gyur na nye bar len //
analyzed: sred par gyur na nye bar len //
translated: When there is craving, there is grasping,

original: rnam pa bzhi po nyer len 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po nyer len 'gyur //
translated: The four types of grasping will occur.

original: nyer len yod na @276b len pa po'i //
analyzed: nyer len yod na @276b len pa po'i //
translated: When there is grasping, the existence

original: srid pa rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Of the one who grasps will occur.

original: gal te nye bar len med na //
analyzed: gal te nye bar len med na //
translated: If there were no appropriation,

original: grol bar 'gyur te srid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: grol bar 'gyur te srid mi 'gyur //
translated: there would be no bondage and no liberation.

original: srid pa de yang phung po lnga //
analyzed: srid pa de yang phung po lnga //
translated: And existence is the five aggregates.

original: srid pa las ni skye ba 'byung //
analyzed: srid pa las ni skye ba 'byung //
translated: From existence comes birth.üîΩFrom birth come aging and death,

original: rga shi dang ni mya ngan dang // smre sngags 'don bcas sdug bsngal dang // yid mi bde dang 'khrug pa rnams ;
analyzed: rga shi dang ni mya ngan dang // smre sngags 'don bcas sdug bsngal dang // yid mi bde dang 'khrug pa rnams ;
translated: grief, lamentation, suffering, depression, and mental anguish.

original: / de dag skye las rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: / de dag skye las rab tu 'byung //
translated: All of these arise from birth.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal phung po ni //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal phung po ni //
translated: Thus this entire mass of suffering

original: 'ba' zhig pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: arises.

original: de phyir mkhas rnams 'khor ba yi //
analyzed: de phyir mkhas rnams 'khor ba yi //
translated: Therefore, the wise do not engage in the formative

original: rtsa ba'i 'du byed 'du mi byed //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i 'du byed 'du mi byed //
translated: forces, which are the root of cyclic existence.

original: de phyir mi mkhas byed pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir mi mkhas byed pa yin //
translated: Therefore, the unwise engage in the formative forces,

original: mkhas min de nyid mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhas min de nyid mthong phyir ro //
translated: but the wise do not, because they see reality.

original: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni ;
analyzed: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni ;
translated: When ignorance ceases,

original: /'du byed rnams kyang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: /'du byed rnams kyang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: the formative forces also cease.

original: ma rig 'gag par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: ma rig 'gag par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: The cessation of ignorance

original: shes pa de nyid bsgoms pas so //üîΩde dang de ni 'gags gyur pas //
analyzed: shes pa de nyid bsgoms pas so // de dang de ni 'gags gyur pas //
translated: comes from cultivating that knowledge.üîΩWhen this ceases and that ceases,

original: de dang de ni mngon mi 'byung //
analyzed: de dang de ni mngon mi 'byung //
translated: this does not manifest.

original: sdug bsngal phung po 'ba' zhig pa //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phung po 'ba' zhig pa //
translated: The mass of suffering is only this.üîΩIt is thus that it ceases.

original: de ni de ltar yang dag 'gag / byis pa ma rig pas bsgribs pas yang srid pa'i phyir sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa 'du byed pa'i 'du byed rnam pa gsum po dag lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang dag 'gag / byis pa ma rig pas bsgribs pas yang srid pa'i phyir sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa 'du byed pa'i 'du byed rnam pa gsum po dag lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: The foolish, obscured by ignorance, form the three kinds of formations leading to new existence, by means of body, speech, and mind, in order to experience the hells and other forms of existence.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba ji ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu gang dag yin pa de dag gis sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su 'gro'o //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba ji ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu gang dag yin pa de dag gis sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su 'gro'o //
translated: By means of the great, middling, and small formations of wholesome and unwholesome actions, they go to the various destinies such as the hells.

original: de la 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyis rnam par shes pa ji ltar 'gro ba rnams su zhugs par gyur pas ming dang gzugs chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyis rnam par shes pa ji ltar 'gro ba rnams su zhugs par gyur pas ming dang gzugs chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, consciousness, conditioned by formations, enters the destinies and attaches to name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs chags par gyur na ming dang gzugs chags pa las skye mched drug 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs chags par gyur na ming dang gzugs chags pa las skye mched drug 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When name-and-form has attached, the six sense bases emerge from attached name-and-form.

original: skye mched drug la brten nas de las reg pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye mched drug la brten nas de las reg pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In dependence on the six sense spheres, contact arises from that.

original: reg pa de skye ba'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: reg pa de skye ba'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The sequence of the arising of contact is as follows:

original: ming dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa la brten nas skye ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa la brten nas skye ba kho na yin te /
translated: It arises in dependence on name-and-form and attention.

original: de ltar ming dang gzugs la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ltar ming dang gzugs la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing //
translated: In this way, consciousness arises in dependence on name-and-form.

original: de ltar ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gsum po 'dus pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gsum po 'dus pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa'o //
translated: In this way, the coming together of the three‚Äîname-and-form, consciousness, and contact‚Äîis contact.

original: reg pa las tshor ba kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩtshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa las tshor ba kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro // tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa ste /
translated: From contact, feeling arises.üîΩWith feeling as a condition, craving arises.

original: tshor ba'i don la sred par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i don la sred par 'gyur ro //
translated: Craving is the desire for the object of feeling.

original: sred par gyur na nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi @277a * //üîΩpo dag nye bar len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred par gyur na nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi @277a * // po dag nye bar len par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is craving, the four kinds of appropriation arise.

original: nye bar len pa yod na len pa po'i srid pa rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa yod na len pa po'i srid pa rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When there is appropriation, the existence of the appropriator arises.

original: gal te nye bar len pa med na des na grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa med na des na grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no appropriation, then he would be liberated.

original: de'i srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig na /
analyzed: de'i srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig na /
translated: But if there were no appropriation, then existence would not occur.

original: gang gi phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa de'i phyir srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa de'i phyir srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because there is appropriation, existence occurs.

original: srid pa de yang phung po lnga yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa de yang phung po lnga yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: And that existence should be understood as the five aggregates.

original: srid pa las ni skye ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: srid pa las ni skye ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: From existence, birth occurs.

original: skye ba las rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba las rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: From birth, aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish occur.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po sdug bsngal gyi tshogs 'ba' zhig ma 'dres pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po sdug bsngal gyi tshogs 'ba' zhig ma 'dres pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this entire great mass of suffering arises.

original: de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i rtsa ba'i 'du byed rnams 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i rtsa ba'i 'du byed rnams 'du mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, the wise do not form the formations that are the root of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir mi mkhas pa rnams ni 'du byed rnams kyi byed pa po yin gyi mkhas pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mkhas pa rnams ni 'du byed rnams kyi byed pa po yin gyi mkhas pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the unwise are the agents of formations, but the wise are not.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is seen.

original: de la ma rig pa ma 'gags par gyur na 'du byed rnams kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ma 'gags par gyur na 'du byed rnams kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If ignorance does not cease, then the formative forces will not arise.

original: ma rig pa 'gag par 'gyur ba ni yan lag bcu gnyis shes pa de nyid bsgom pa goms par bya ba dang / brtan po nyid du byas pas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gag par 'gyur ba ni yan lag bcu gnyis shes pa de nyid bsgom pa goms par bya ba dang / brtan po nyid du byas pas so //
translated: The cessation of ignorance is due to the cultivation and practice of the knowledge of the twelve limbs.

original: srid pa'i yan lag de dang de 'gags par gyur pas srid pa'i yan lag de dang de mngon par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag de dang de 'gags par gyur pas srid pa'i yan lag de dang de mngon par mi 'byung ste /
translated: When one limb of existence ceases, then another limb of existence does not arise.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po sdug bsngal gyi tshogs 'ba' zhig pa ma 'dres pa de yang dag par 'gag cing gtan 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po sdug bsngal gyi tshogs 'ba' zhig pa ma 'dres pa de yang dag par 'gag cing gtan 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the mass of suffering, the mass of pure suffering, ceases completely and finally.

original: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag la 'jug pa rgya cher mdo sde dang chos mngon pa dag las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag la 'jug pa rgya cher mdo sde dang chos mngon pa dag las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the twelve limbs of existence should be understood from the sutras and the Abhidharma.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i dbang gis 'di la'ang brjod do //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i dbang gis 'di la'ang brjod do //
translated: Here, it is stated in brief.

original: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the investigation of the twelve limbs of existence.

original: rab tu byed pa nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o /üîΩ// /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o / // /'dir smras pa /
translated: This is the twenty-sixth chapter, on the Critique of the Twenty Views.üîΩHere someone might say, ‚ÄúNow, relying on the sutras that accord with theüîΩhearer vehicle, you should demonstrate that the views are impossible.‚ÄùüîΩThe views that in the past I existed,

original: da khyod kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa dang mthun pa'i mdo sde'i mtha' la brten nas lta ba'i rnam pa rnams mi srid par ston cig /'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: da khyod kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa dang mthun pa'i mdo sde'i mtha' la brten nas lta ba'i rnam pa rnams mi srid par ston cig /'dir bshad pa /
translated: That in the past I did not exist,üîΩThat in the past I both existed and did not exist,

original: 'das pa'i dus na byung zhes dang // ma byung 'jig rten rtag sogs par //üîΩlta ba gang yin de dag ni //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na byung zhes dang // ma byung 'jig rten rtag sogs par // lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
translated: And that in the past I neither existed nor did not exist,

original: sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //üîΩma 'ongs dus gzhan 'byung 'gyur dang // mi 'byung 'jig rten @277b mtha' stsogs par //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin // ma 'ongs dus gzhan 'byung 'gyur dang // mi 'byung 'jig rten @277b mtha' stsogs par //
translated: Are based on the prior limit.üîΩThe views that in the future I will exist,üîΩThat in the future I will not exist,üîΩThat in the future I will both exist and not exist,

original: lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
analyzed: lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
translated: And that in the future I will neither exist nor not exist,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa yin //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa yin //
translated: Are based on the posterior limit.

original: zag pa thams cad sdom pa'i rnam grangs zhes bya ba'i mdo sde las gsungs pa bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya ba dang / bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar ma gyur ces bya ba'i rgyu 'dis 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs par lta ba gang yin pa de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa thams cad sdom pa'i rnam grangs zhes bya ba'i mdo sde las gsungs pa bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya ba dang / bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar ma gyur ces bya ba'i rgyu 'dis 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs par lta ba gang yin pa de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no //
translated: The sutra called the Enumeration of the Aggregates of Defilement says:üîΩThe views that the world is permanent, etc., are based on the prior limit, because of the reason that ‚ÄúI existed in the past‚Äù or ‚ÄúI did not exist in the past.‚Äù

original: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rgyu 'dis 'jig rten mtha' yod pa la sogs par lta ba gang yin pa de dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rgyu 'dis 'jig rten mtha' yod pa la sogs par lta ba gang yin pa de dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa yin no //
translated: The views that the world has an end, etc., are based on the posterior limit, because of the reason that ‚ÄúI will exist in the future‚Äù or ‚ÄúI will not exist in the future.‚Äù

original: de dag ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de dag ni mi 'thad de /
translated: These are untenable.

original: rigs pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what reasoning?

original: bshad par bya ste /üîΩ'das pa'i dus na byung gyur ces //
analyzed: bshad par bya ste / 'das pa'i dus na byung gyur ces //
translated: We will explain.üîΩIt is untenable to say

original: bya ba de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bya ba de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: ‚ÄúI existed in the past.‚Äù

original: sngon tshe rnams su gang byung ba //
analyzed: sngon tshe rnams su gang byung ba //
translated: It is not the case that what arose in the past

original: de nyid 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: Is this very self.

original: de nyid bdag tu 'gyur snyam na //üîΩnye bar len pa tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid bdag tu 'gyur snyam na // nye bar len pa tha dad 'gyur //
translated: If you think that it is that very self,üîΩThe appropriated would be different.

original: nye bar len pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the appropriated,

original: khyod kyi bdag ni gang zhig yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi bdag ni gang zhig yin //
translated: What is your self?

original: nye bar len pa ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: When it is said that ‚ÄúWithout the appropriated,

original: bdag yod ma yin byas pa'i tshe //
analyzed: bdag yod ma yin byas pa'i tshe //
translated: The self does not exist,‚Äù

original: nye bar len nyid bdag yin na //
analyzed: nye bar len nyid bdag yin na //
translated: If the appropriated itself is the self,

original: khyod kyi bdag ni med pa yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi bdag ni med pa yin //
translated: Your self would not exist.

original: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
analyzed: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
translated: The appropriated itself is not the self,

original: de ni 'byung dang 'jig pa yin ;
analyzed: de ni 'byung dang 'jig pa yin ;
translated: For it arises and ceases.

original: / nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
analyzed: / nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
translated: How could the appropriated

original: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //üîΩbdag ni nye bar len pa las //
analyzed: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur // bdag ni nye bar len pa las //
translated: Be the appropriator?

original: gzhan du 'thad pa nyid ma yin //üîΩgal te gzhan na len med par //
analyzed: gzhan du 'thad pa nyid ma yin // gal te gzhan na len med par //
translated: The self is not tenable as differentüîΩFrom the appropriated.

original: gzung yod rigs na gzung du med //
analyzed: gzung yod rigs na gzung du med //
translated: If it were different, it would be apprehended without the appropriated,üîΩBut it is not apprehended.

original: de ltar len nas gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar len nas gzhan ma yin //
translated: Thus it is not different from the appropriated,

original: de ni nyer len nyid kyang min //
analyzed: de ni nyer len nyid kyang min //
translated: Nor is it the appropriated itself.

original: bdag ni nye bar len med min //
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len med min //
translated: The self is not without the appropriated,

original: med pa nyid du'ang de ma nges //
analyzed: med pa nyid du'ang de ma nges //
translated: But it is not ascertained as nonexistent.

original: bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya ba de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya ba de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúI existed in the past.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sngon gyi tshe rabs su gang byung bar gyur pa de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'di ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshe rabs su gang byung bar gyur pa de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'di ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which existed in previous lives is not this self of the present.

original: de la 'di snyam du gal te sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su gang byung bar gyur pa de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'di yin par gyur na de'i phyir skyon cir 'gyur snyam du sems na de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gal te sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su gang byung bar gyur pa de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'di yin par gyur na de'i phyir skyon cir 'gyur snyam du sems na de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúIf that which existed in previous lives were this self of the present, what would be the error?‚Äù then we would say this:

original: gal te sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su gang byung bar gyur pa de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'di yin par gyur na de lta na nye bar len pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ba zhig na nye bar len pa tha dad par yang @278a * //
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su gang byung bar gyur pa de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'di yin par gyur na de lta na nye bar len pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ba zhig na nye bar len pa tha dad par yang @278a * //
translated: If that which existed in previous lives were this self of the present, then appropriation would not be different.

original: 'gyur la / nye bar len pa ma gtogs par bdag yod par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur la / nye bar len pa ma gtogs par bdag yod par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But appropriation is different, and it follows that the self would exist without appropriation.

original: de la nye bar len pa ma gtogs pa khyod kyi bdag de gang zhig yin par smra bar nus sam /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa ma gtogs pa khyod kyi bdag de gang zhig yin par smra bar nus sam /
translated: Apart from appropriation, what is your self?

original: kho bos ni rnam pa thams cad du yang mi 'thad par shes so //
analyzed: kho bos ni rnam pa thams cad du yang mi 'thad par shes so //
translated: We understand it to be completely untenable.

original: de la 'di snyam du nye bar len pa ma gtogs pa'i bdag yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems na ni /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du nye bar len pa ma gtogs pa'i bdag yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems na ni /
translated: But if you think that apart from appropriation, there is no self,

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then either appropriation itself is the self,

original: yang na khyod kyi bdag med pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na khyod kyi bdag med pa yin no //
translated: or your self does not exist.

original: nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is untenable to say that appropriation itself is the self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nye bar len pa de ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa yin pas skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa de ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa yin pas skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because appropriation arises and ceases, it is born and it ceases.

original: de lta bu ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the defining characteristic of the self.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: nye bar blang ba gang yin pa de nyid ji lta bur nye bar len pa po yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba gang yin pa de nyid ji lta bur nye bar len pa po yin par 'gyur te /
translated: how could that which is appropriated be the appropriator?

original: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because many faults would follow.

original: de la 'di snyam du nye bar blang ba las nye bar len pa po gzhan yin par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du nye bar blang ba las nye bar len pa po gzhan yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the appropriator is different from that appropriated,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bdag ni nye bar len pa las gzhan du 'thad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len pa las gzhan du 'thad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The self is not tenable as different from that appropriated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te gzhan yin na nye bar len pa med par yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyis gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta na bdag nyid nye bar len pa las gzhan yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te gzhan yin na nye bar len pa med par yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyis gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa'i phyir ro // de lta na bdag nyid nye bar len pa las gzhan yang ma yin la /
translated: If it were different, it would be reasonable that the self would be apprehended by the faculties such as the eyes without the appropriated aggregates, but it is not apprehended.üîΩThus the self is not different from the appropriated aggregates,

original: de ni nye bar len pa nyid kyang ma yin /üîΩnye bar len pa med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ni nye bar len pa nyid kyang ma yin / nye bar len pa med pa yang ma yin /
translated: and it is not the appropriated aggregates themselves,üîΩand it is not without appropriation.

original: 'ga' yang med pa nyid du nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang med pa nyid du nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not ascertained to be absolutely nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa 'dis bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur zhes bya ba de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa 'dis bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur zhes bya ba de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is untenable to say, ‚ÄúThe self existed in the past.‚ÄùüîΩNow,

original: da ni ; 'das pa'i dus na ma byung zhes //
analyzed: da ni ; 'das pa'i dus na ma byung zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúIt did not exist in the past‚Äù

original: bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: That is also untenable.üîΩIt is not that this is different

original: sngon tshe rnams su gang byung ba //üîΩde las 'di gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon tshe rnams su gang byung ba // de las 'di gzhan ma yin no //
translated: from that which occurred in previous lives.

original: gal te 'di ni gzhan gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni gzhan gyur na //
translated: If this were different from that,

original: de med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would occur even without that.

original: de bzhin du ni gnas 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gnas 'gyur zhing //
translated: It would remain as it was

original: de 'am shi bar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de 'am shi bar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: or arise after it has died.

original: chad dang las rnams chud za dang // gzhan gyis byas pa'i las rnams ni //
analyzed: chad dang las rnams chud za dang // gzhan gyis byas pa'i las rnams ni //
translated: Annihilation, the loss of karma,üîΩthe experience of karma created by another, and so on

original: gzhan gyis so sor myong ba dang // de la sogs par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis so sor myong ba dang // de la sogs par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would ensue.

original: ma byung ba las byung min te //
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung min te //
translated: It does not arise from what has not occurred,

original: 'di la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: because that would entail errors.üîΩThe self would be created,

original: bdag ni byas par 'gyur ba dang // 'byung ba rgyu med can du 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag ni byas par 'gyur ba dang // 'byung ba rgyu med can du 'gyur //
translated: and its occurrence would be causeless.

original: da ni bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar @278b ma gyur ces bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: da ni bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar @278b ma gyur ces bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Now, it is also untenable to say, ‚ÄúI did not exist in the past.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su gang byung bar gyur pa de las 'di gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su gang byung bar gyur pa de las 'di gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is not different from that which occurred in previous lives.

original: gal te 'di gzhan yin par gyur na de'i phyir de med par yang 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di gzhan yin par gyur na de'i phyir de med par yang 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If this were different, then it would arise even when that does not exist.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: snga ma de de bzhin du de na gnas par 'gyur zhing 'di yang der ma shi bar 'dir skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma de de bzhin du de na gnas par 'gyur zhing 'di yang der ma shi bar 'dir skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the former would remain just as it is, and this would be born here without dying there.

original: de lta na chad pa dang las rnams chud za ba dang gzhan gyis byas pa'i las rnams gzhan gyis so sor myong ba dang de la sogs pa skyon mang po dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na chad pa dang las rnams chud za ba dang gzhan gyis byas pa'i las rnams gzhan gyis so sor myong ba dang de la sogs pa skyon mang po dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the error of nihilism, the destruction of karma, the experience of karma created by another, and so on would ensue.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: de lta na bdag ma byung ba las byung bar thal bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de lta na bdag ma byung ba las byung bar thal bar 'gyur te ;
translated: in that case, it would follow that the self would arise from what is non-self,

original: bdag ma byung ba las byung ba ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: bdag ma byung ba las byung ba ni ma yin pas /
translated: but the self does not arise from what is non-self.

original: de'i phyir 'di la yang bdag byas par 'gyur ba dang / 'byung ba rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la yang bdag byas par 'gyur ba dang / 'byung ba rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the error of the self being created and arising causelessly would ensue, and that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa 'dis bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar ma gyur ces bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //üîΩde ltar bdag byung bdag ma byung //üîΩgnyi ga gnyi ga ma yin par //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa 'dis bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar ma gyur ces bya ba de yang mi 'thad do // de ltar bdag byung bdag ma byung // gnyi ga gnyi ga ma yin par //
translated: Therefore, it is also untenable to say, ‚ÄúI did not exist in the past.‚ÄùüîΩThus, the views that the self existed in the past,üîΩthat the self did not exist in the past,üîΩthat the self both existed and did not exist in the past,

original: 'das la lta ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'das la lta ba gang yin pa //
translated: and that the self neither existed nor did not exist in the past

original: de dag 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: are untenable.

original: de ltar yongs su brtags na bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya ba dang / bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar ma gyur ces bya ba dang / sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur kyang gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su brtags na bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya ba dang / bdag sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar ma gyur ces bya ba dang / sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur kyang gyur la /
translated: Thus, when examined in this way, the views that the self existed in the past, that the self did not exist in the past, that the self both existed and did not exist in the past,üîΩthat the self existed in the past and also did not exist in the past,

original: byung ba'am gyur kyang ma gyur ces bya ba dang / sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa yang ma yin /üîΩbyung bar ma gyur pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar 'das pa'i dus la lta ba gang yin pa de dag 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byung ba'am gyur kyang ma gyur ces bya ba dang / sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa yang ma yin /üîΩbyung bar ma gyur pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar 'das pa'i dus la lta ba gang yin pa de dag 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: that the self neither existed nor did not exist in the past are untenable.

original: da ni ; ma 'ongs dus gzhan 'byung 'gyur dang // 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya bar //
analyzed: da ni ; ma 'ongs dus gzhan 'byung 'gyur dang // 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya bar //
translated: Now, in the future,üîΩit will arise or it will not arise.üîΩ

original: lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
analyzed: lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
translated: Now, the views that the self will arise or will not arise in another future timeüîΩare the same as those

original: 'das pa'i dus dang mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus dang mtshungs pa yin //
translated: in the past.

original: da ni bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya bar ma 'ongs pa'i dus la lta ba gang yin pa de dag ni 'das pa'i dus dang mtshungs par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya bar ma 'ongs pa'i dus la lta ba gang yin pa de dag ni 'das pa'i dus dang mtshungs par bsam par bya ste /
translated: Now, the views that the self will arise in another future time and that the self will not arise in another future time are the same as those in the past.

original: 'das pa'i dus las brtsams pa'i skyon gang dag yin pa de dag nyid 'dir yang bye brag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus las brtsams pa'i skyon gang dag yin pa de dag nyid 'dir yang bye brag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: The errors that were shown in relation to the past should be understood as applying here as well.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te lha de mi de na //
analyzed: gal te lha de mi de na //
translated: If that god is this man,

original: de lta na ni rtag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta na ni rtag par 'gyur //
translated: then he would be permanent.

original: lha ni ma skyes nyid 'gyur te //üîΩrtag @279a * //
analyzed: lha ni ma skyes nyid 'gyur te // rtag @279a * //
translated: The god would be unborn,üîΩbecause

original: la skye ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: la skye ba med phyir ro //
translated: the permanent does not arise.

original: gal te lha de nyid mi de nyid du gyur na de lta na ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lha de nyid mi de nyid du gyur na de lta na ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the god himself became the man himself, then he would be permanent.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: lha ma skyes pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha ma skyes pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: the god would be unborn.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtag pa la skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa la skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no arising of a permanent thing.

original: gang gi phyir lha gang yin pa de nyid mi ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lha gang yin pa de nyid mi ma yin zhing /
translated: Because the god himself is not the man himself,

original: lha ma skyes pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lha ma skyes pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: and the god is not unborn, therefore he is not permanent.

original: gal te lha las mi gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te lha las mi gzhan na //
translated: If the man were different from the god,

original: de lta na ni mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta na ni mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: then he would be impermanent.

original: gal te lha mi gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gal te lha mi gzhan yin no //
translated: If the man were different from the god,

original: rgyud ni 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud ni 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the continuum would not be tenable.

original: gal te lha las mi gzhan yin na de lta na ni mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lha las mi gzhan yin na de lta na ni mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the man were different from the god, then he would be impermanent.

original: rgyud kyi gtan tshigs kyis lha las mi gzhan yin par mi 'thad pas de'i phyir mi rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud kyi gtan tshigs kyis lha las mi gzhan yin par mi 'thad pas de'i phyir mi rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the man is different from the god due to the reason of the continuum, therefore he is not impermanent.

original: gal te phyogs gcig lha yin la //
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig lha yin la //
translated: If one part were the god

original: phyogs gcig mi ni yin gyur na //
analyzed: phyogs gcig mi ni yin gyur na //
translated: and one part were the man,

original: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: then he would be both permanent and impermanent.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That also is illogical.

original: gal te phyogs gcig ni lha yin la phyogs gcig ni mi yin par gyur na de lta na rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig ni lha yin la phyogs gcig ni mi yin par gyur na de lta na rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If one part were a god and one part were a human, then in that case, it would be permanent and also impermanent.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag nyid gnyis pa nyid mi rigs pa de'i phyir rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag nyid gnyis pa nyid mi rigs pa de'i phyir rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: But because it is illogical that it has two natures, therefore it is not permanent and also not impermanent.

original: gal te rtag dang mi rtag pa //
analyzed: gal te rtag dang mi rtag pa //
translated: If both the permanent and the impermanent

original: gnyi ga grub par gyur na ni //üîΩrtag pa ma yin mi rtag min //üîΩ'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod la rag / gal te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga rab tu grub par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga grub par gyur na ni // rtag pa ma yin mi rtag min // 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod la rag / gal te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga rab tu grub par gyur na ni /
translated: were established,üîΩthen it would be established that it is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIf both the so-called permanent and impermanent were established,

original: de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod la rag na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod la rag na /
translated: then it would be established that it is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa de gnyi ga rab tu ma grub pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de yang rab tu mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa de gnyi ga rab tu ma grub pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de yang rab tu mi 'grub bo //
translated: Because both permanence and impermanence are not established, therefore that which is called ‚Äúneither permanent nor impermanent‚Äù is also not established.

original: gal te gang zhig gang nas 'ongs //
analyzed: gal te gang zhig gang nas 'ongs //
translated: If something came from somewhere

original: ci zhig gang du 'gro 'gyur na //üîΩde phyir de la thog med pas //
analyzed: ci zhig gang du 'gro 'gyur na // de phyir de la thog med pas //
translated: and something went somewhere,

original: rtag par gyur na de yang med //
analyzed: rtag par gyur na de yang med //
translated: then it would be permanent because it would be beginningless, but that does not exist.

original: gal te dngos po gang zhig yul gang nas 'ongs shing ci zhig gcig tu gang du 'gro bar 'gyur na ni de'i phyir de la thog ma med pas rtag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gang zhig yul gang nas 'ongs shing ci zhig gcig tu gang du 'gro bar 'gyur na ni de'i phyir de la thog ma med pas rtag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If something came from somewhere and something went somewhere, then it would be permanent because it would be beginningless.

original: shes rab kyis brtsal na dngos po gang zhig yul gang nas 'ongs shing /
analyzed: shes rab kyis brtsal na dngos po gang zhig yul gang nas 'ongs shing /
translated: But when one searches with wisdom, no thing whatsoever comes from somewhere and goes somewhere.

original: ji zhig gcig tu gang 'gro bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pas de'i phyir de la thog ma med pa yang med pas rtag pa ma yin @279b no ;
analyzed: ji zhig gcig tu gang 'gro bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pas de'i phyir de la thog ma med pa yang med pas rtag pa ma yin @279b no ;
translated: Therefore, since it is not permanent because it is not beginningless, it is not permanent.

original: / gal te rtag pa 'ga' med na //
analyzed: / gal te rtag pa 'ga' med na //
translated: If something permanent does not exist,

original: mi rtag gang zhig yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag gang zhig yin par 'gyur //
translated: What is impermanent?üîΩPermanent and impermanent,

original: rtag pa dang ni mi rtag dang // de gnyis bsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ni mi rtag dang // de gnyis bsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: and both of those are eliminated.

original: gal te de ltar shes rab kyis brtags na dngos po 'ga' yang med na mi rtag pa gang zhig yin par gyur /
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes rab kyis brtags na dngos po 'ga' yang med na mi rtag pa gang zhig yin par gyur /
translated: If one examines with wisdom in that way, since there are no things at all, what is impermanent?

original: rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa yang gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa yang gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: What is permanent and impermanent, and what is neither permanent nor impermanent?

original: de lta bas na sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams pa'i rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi po de dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams pa'i rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi po de dag mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the four beginning with permanence in relation to the prior limit are untenable.

original: da ni ; phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams pa'i mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhi po de dag ji ltar mi 'thad pa /
analyzed: da ni ; phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams pa'i mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhi po de dag ji ltar mi 'thad pa /
translated: Now, how are the four beginning with the end and endless in relation to the posterior limit untenable?

original: de ltar bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bshad par bya ste /
translated: That will be explained.

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If one asks, how?üîΩIt is said:

original: bshad pa / gal te 'jig rten mtha' yod na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'jig rten mtha' yod na //
translated: If the world had an end,

original: 'jig rten pha rol ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could there be a world beyond?

original: gal te 'jig rten mtha' med na //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten mtha' med na //
translated: If the world has no end,

original: 'jig rten pha rol ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could there be a world beyond?

original: 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the world has an end.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te 'jig rten pha rol yod par gyur na /üîΩde'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol yod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pha rol yod par gyur na / de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol yod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the world beyond exists,üîΩthen the world beyond would not exist.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang yod pas de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang yod pas de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: But since the world beyond exists, therefore it is not tenable to say that the world has an end.

original: 'jig rten mtha' med ces bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' med ces bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: It is also not tenable to say that the world has no end.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te 'jig rten mtha' med par gyur na de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten mtha' med par gyur na de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the world had no end, then the world beyond would not exist.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang yod pas de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' med ces bya ba yang yod pas de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' med ces bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang yod pas de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' med ces bya ba yang yod pas de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' med ces bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But since the world beyond exists, therefore it is not tenable to say that the world has no end.

original: de gnyis ci'i phyir mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: de gnyis ci'i phyir mi 'thad ce na /
translated: Why are those two not tenable?

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, we shall explain that.

original: gang phyir phung po rnams kyi rgyun //
analyzed: gang phyir phung po rnams kyi rgyun //
translated: Because the continuum of the aggregates

original: 'di ni mar me'i 'od dang mtshungs //üîΩde phyir mtha' yod nyid dang ni //
analyzed: 'di ni mar me'i 'od dang mtshungs // de phyir mtha' yod nyid dang ni //
translated: Is similar to the flame of a lamp.üîΩTherefore, it is not logical

original: mtha' med nyid kyang mi rigs so //
analyzed: mtha' med nyid kyang mi rigs so //
translated: That the world has an end or is infinite.

original: gang gi phyir phung po rnams kyi rgyun 'di ni mar me'i 'od dang mtshungs par rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod pa nyid dang / mtha' med pa nyid ces bya ba yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po rnams kyi rgyun 'di ni mar me'i 'od dang mtshungs par rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod pa nyid dang / mtha' med pa nyid ces bya ba yang mi rigs so //
translated: Because this continuum of the aggregates arises through the power of the collection of causes and conditions, like the flame of a lamp, therefore it is not logical to say that the world has an end or is infinite.

original: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it not logical?

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te snga ma 'jig 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gal te snga ma 'jig 'gyur zhing //
translated: If the previous one disintegrates

original: phung po 'di la brten byas nas //
analyzed: phung po 'di la brten byas nas //
translated: And this aggregate is produced in dependence on it,

original: phung po 'di ni mi 'byung na //
analyzed: phung po 'di ni mi 'byung na //
translated: And this aggregate does not arise,

original: des na 'jig rten mtha' yod 'gyur //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten mtha' yod 'gyur //
translated: Then the world would have an end.

original: gal te snga ma mi @280a * //
analyzed: gal te snga ma mi @280a * //
translated: If the previous one does not disintegrate

original: 'jig cing // phung po 'di la brten byas nas //
analyzed: 'jig cing // phung po 'di la brten byas nas //
translated: And this aggregate is produced in dependence on it,

original: phung po 'di ni mi 'byung na //
analyzed: phung po 'di ni mi 'byung na //
translated: And this aggregate does not arise,

original: des na 'jig rten mtha' med 'gyur //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten mtha' med 'gyur //
translated: Then the world would be infinite.

original: gal te phung po snga ma rnams 'jig par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te phung po snga ma rnams 'jig par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the previous aggregates were to perishüîΩand the other aggregates did not arise in dependence on those aggregates, then the world would have an end.

original: phung po 'di dag la brten nas phung po gzhan de dag mi 'byung na ni des na 'jig rten mtha' yod par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phung po 'di dag la brten nas phung po gzhan de dag mi 'byung na ni des na 'jig rten mtha' yod par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: But because that is not the case, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúThe world has an end.‚Äù

original: gal te phung po snga ma rnams mi 'jig cing phung po de dag la brten nas phung po phyi ma de dag mi 'byung na ni des na 'jig rten mtha' med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te phung po snga ma rnams mi 'jig cing phung po de dag la brten nas phung po phyi ma de dag mi 'byung na ni des na 'jig rten mtha' med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the previous aggregates did not perish and the other aggregates did not arise in dependence on those aggregates, then the world would be endless.

original: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' med pa zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' med pa zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But because that is not the case, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúThe world is endless.‚Äù

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva also says:üîΩIt is very rare for a listener, something to be heard,

original: nyan pa po dang mnyan bya dang // smra po 'byung ba shin tu dkon //
analyzed: nyan pa po dang mnyan bya dang // smra po 'byung ba shin tu dkon //
translated: and a speaker to occur.

original: de phyir mdor na 'khor ba ni //
analyzed: de phyir mdor na 'khor ba ni //
translated: Therefore, in brief, the world

original: mtha' yod ma yin mtha' med min //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtha' yod ma yin mtha' med min //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: is neither finite nor infinite.

original: da ni 'jig rten mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med ces bya ba de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med ces bya ba de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Now, it is also untenable to say that the world is finite and also infinite.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad par bya ste /üîΩgal te phyogs gcig mtha' yod la //
analyzed: bshad par bya ste / gal te phyogs gcig mtha' yod la //
translated: It is explained:üîΩIf one part were finite

original: phyogs gcig mtha' ni med gyur na //
analyzed: phyogs gcig mtha' ni med gyur na //
translated: And one part were infinite,

original: 'jig rten mtha' yod mtha' med 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' yod mtha' med 'gyur //
translated: The world would be finite and infinite.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩgal te phyogs gcig mtha' yod par gyur la /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no // gal te phyogs gcig mtha' yod par gyur la /
translated: But that also is not logical.

original: phyogs gcig mtha' med par gyur na ni de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod kyang yod la /üîΩmtha' med kyang med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: phyogs gcig mtha' med par gyur na ni de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod kyang yod la / mtha' med kyang med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If one part were finite and one part were infinite, then the world would be finite and also infinite.

original: de lta na dngos po bdag nyid gnyis pa nyid du gyur pa de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta na dngos po bdag nyid gnyis pa nyid du gyur pa de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: But that is not tenable, because it would follow that a thing would have two natures.

original: ji lta bur na nyer len po //üîΩphyogs gcig rnam par 'jig 'gyur la //
analyzed: ji lta bur na nyer len po // phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig 'gyur la //
translated: How could the appropriatorüîΩBe partially destroyed

original: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig mi 'gyur //
translated: And partially undestroyed?

original: de ltar de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar de ni mi rigs so //
translated: That is not logical.

original: ji lta bur na nyer blang ba //
analyzed: ji lta bur na nyer blang ba //
translated: How could the appropriated

original: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig 'gyur la //
analyzed: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig 'gyur la //
translated: One part would be destroyed,

original: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig mi 'gyur //
translated: and one part would not be destroyed.

original: de ltar de yang mi rigs so //üîΩre zhig nye bar len pa po rigs pa gang gis phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar de yang mi rigs so // re zhig nye bar len pa po rigs pa gang gis phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig par 'gyur la /
translated: But that also is not tenable.

original: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: First, by what reasoning would the appropriator be such that one part would be destroyed and one part would not be destroyed?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid med pa'i phyir re zhig de ltar ni mi rigs so //üîΩnye bar blang ba yang rnam pa gang gis phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid med pa'i phyir re zhig de ltar ni mi rigs so // nye bar blang ba yang rnam pa gang gis phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig par 'gyur la /
translated: That is not tenable, because it would not be permanent and impermanent.

original: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig rnam par 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, by what reasoning would the appropriated be such that one part would be destroyed and one part would not be destroyed?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid mi 'thad pa kho na'i phyir de @280b ltar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid mi 'thad pa kho na'i phyir de @280b ltar yang mi rigs so //
translated: That also is not tenable, because it would not be permanent and impermanent.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po bdag nyid gnyis pa nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po bdag nyid gnyis pa nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, because it is not tenable that an entity has a twofold nature, therefore it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúThe world has an end and also does not have an end.‚Äù

original: da ni 'jig rten mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Now, it is also untenable to say, ‚ÄúThe world has no end and also has no end.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: gal te mtha' yod mtha' med pa //
analyzed: gal te mtha' yod mtha' med pa //
translated: If having an end and having no end

original: gnyi ga grub par gyur na ni //
analyzed: gnyi ga grub par gyur na ni //
translated: Were established,

original: mtha' yod ma yin mtha' med min //üîΩ'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod la rag / gal te mtha' yod pa dang mtha' med pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga rab tu grub par gyur na ni de'i phyir mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di rab tu 'grub
analyzed: mtha' yod ma yin mtha' med min // 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod la rag / gal te mtha' yod pa dang mtha' med pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga rab tu grub par gyur na ni de'i phyir mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di rab tu 'grub
translated: Then not having an end and not having no endüîΩWould be established.üîΩIf having an end and having no end were established, then having no end and not having no end would be established.

original: par 'gyur bar yang 'dod la rag na gang gi phyir mtha' yod pa dang / mtha' med pa zhes bya ba de gnyis rab tu ma grub pa de'i phyir mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /üîΩmtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yang rab tu ma grub bo //
analyzed: par 'gyur bar yang 'dod la rag na gang gi phyir mtha' yod pa dang / mtha' med pa zhes bya ba de gnyis rab tu ma grub pa de'i phyir mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /üîΩmtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yang rab tu ma grub bo //
translated: But because having an end and having no end are not established, therefore not having an end and not having no end are also not established.

original: de lta bas na brtag pa 'dis phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams pa'i mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhi mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na brtag pa 'dis phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams pa'i mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhi mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, by this analysis, the four possibilities beginning with the future are untenable.üîΩOr, since all things are empty,

analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad dag / stong phyir rtag la sogs lta ba // gang du gang la gang dag ni //
translated: how could the views of permanence, etc.

original: ci'i phyir kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //

analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad stong pa'i phyir // rtag pa la sogs par lta ba dag yul dang dus gang du dngos po gang la /

original: lta ba gang dag / rgyu ci'i phyir kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lta ba gang dag / rgyu ci'i phyir kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: arise in regard to what object, at what time, in regard to what person, and for what reason?üîΩWe pay homage to Gautama,

original: gang gis thugs brtse nyer bzung nas //
analyzed: gang gis thugs brtse nyer bzung nas //
translated: who, out of compassion,üîΩtaught the true Dharma

original: lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir //üîΩdam pa'i chos ni ston mdzad pa //üîΩgoo ta ma de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir // dam pa'i chos ni ston mdzad pa // goo ta ma de la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: gang gis thugs brtse bas nye bar bzung nas lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir /

original: dam pa'i chos bsten par mdzad pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shin tu rmad du byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa mtshungs pa med pa gzhal du med pa gdung goo ta ma dang gcig pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsten par mdzad pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shin tu rmad du byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa mtshungs pa med pa gzhal du med pa gdung goo ta ma dang gcig pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the BhagavƒÅn Buddha, the one of the Gautama family, who is extremely marvelous, inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, and who has practiced the true Dharma.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gsal bar byed pa /
